General Assembly Condemns U.S. Decree on Jerusalem|work=[[The New York Times]]|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2017/12/21/world/middleeast/trump-jerusalem-united-nations.html|access-date=December 21, 2017}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|last=Huet|first=Natalie|date=March 22, 2019|access-date=October 4, 2021|title=Outcry as Trump backs Israeli sovereignty over Golan Heights|work=[[Euronews]]|agency=[[Reuters]]|url=https://www.euronews.com/2019/03/22/outcry-as-trump-backs-israeli-sovereignty-over-golan-heights}}</ref> '''In 2020, the White House hosted the signing of the [[Abraham Accords]], normalizing the foreign relations of Israel with the United Arab Emirates and Bahrain.'''}}

[[User:Onetwothreeip|Onetwothreeip]] ([[User talk:Onetwothreeip|talk]]) 10:02, 2 December 2023 (UTC)}}

{{tq|The '''battle of Bakhmut''' was a major battle in and around the city of [[Bakhmut]] between the [[Russian Armed Forces]] and [[Armed Forces of Ukraine|Ukrainian defenders]] '''for capture of the city''' during the larger [[eastern Ukraine campaign]].}}

=== [[Talk:Vanessa Marquez#rfc_BBA37FF|Talk:Vanessa Marquez]] expired 2024-01-06 20:01 ===
* Id: BBA37FF
* User: Kurtis
* Date: 2023-12-07 19:03:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|1188804770|BIO 1188804770}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|1194016096|BIO 1194016096}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
I originally [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wikipedia:External_links/Noticeboard#Vanessa_Marquez posted] about this on the [[WP:ELN|external links noticeboard]], but I think a full-fledged RfC might be the best way to bring in outside perspectives. Basically, I want to discuss whether the police bodycam footage of her fatal shooting merits inclusion in the article itself. The link to the YouTube video was originally added in [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Vanessa_Marquez&diff=prev&oldid=944340424 March 2020]; the video itself was later uploaded and added to the article in [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Vanessa_Marquez&diff=prev&oldid=1155862082 May of this year]. It is narrated, with a viewer discretion warning at the start, and the shots of her incapacitated body and the officer who fired the weapon are both blurred, so it's not as if no effort was made to depict what transpired in a respectful light; nevertheless, it still feels like something that should be approved by community consensus first. [[User:Kurtis|Kurtis]] [[User talk:Kurtis|<sup>(talk)</sup>]] 19:03, 7 December 2023 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Donald Trump 2024 presidential campaign#rfc_14EB4A7|Talk:Donald Trump 2024 presidential campaign]] expired 2024-01-07 01:01 ===
* Id: 14EB4A7
* User: 67.82.74.5
* Date: 2023-12-20 20:21:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1191467169|POL 1191467169}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1197274988|POL 1197274988}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Should we state in the lead that the Colorado Court ruled that Trump is disqualified from the presidency under the 14th amendment for engaging in insurrection, and ordered that he be removed from the Colorado ballot as a result?

Reliable sources like CBS news describe the Colorado ruling as follows: "In a stunning decision that could have major ramifications for the 2024 presidential election, the Colorado Supreme Court on Tuesday ruled that former President Donald Trump is disqualified from holding office again and ordered the secretary of state to remove his name from the state's primary ballot." https://www.cbsnews.com/news/colorado-supreme-court-opinions-decision-trump-primary-ballot/. The Court itself describes its holding in very similar terms: "A majority of the court holds that President Trump is ineligible from holding the office of President under section three of the fourteenth amendment to the Constitution...The sum of these parts is this: President Trump is disqualified from holding the office of President under Section Three; because he is disqualified, it would be a wrongful act under the Election Code for the Secretary to list him as a candidate on the presidential primary ballot." Should we add this material to the lead and adopt similar language, stating something like: 
<blockquote>The Colorado Supreme Court ruled that Trump is disqualified from the Presidency under section three of the 14th amendment for engaging in insurrection against the United States, and ordered that he be removed from the Colorado presidential ballot as a result. The decision is stayed pending appeal to the United States Supreme Court.</blockquote> [[Special:Contributions/67.82.74.5|67.82.74.5]] ([[User talk:67.82.74.5|talk]]) 20:21, 20 December 2023 (UTC)}}


=== [[Talk:Donald Trump 2024 presidential campaign#rfc_ACE237F|Talk:Donald Trump 2024 presidential campaign]] expired 2024-01-07 01:01 ===
* Id: ACE237F
* User: 67.82.74.5
* Date: 2023-12-08 01:00:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1188842643|POL 1188842643}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1194062988|POL 1194062988}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Reliable sources agree that Trump said that he'd be a dictator on "day one," and use this exact phraseology: the Atlantic "Donald Trump, the former president of the United States who tried to steal the 2020 election, says he‚Äôll be a dictator on day one of a second term. That‚Äôs not the rhetorical excess of the mainstream press, nor is it the cynical spin of a political rival. It‚Äôs just what Trump said." "Trump says he'll be a dictator on 'day one'", CBS "Trump says he would be a dictator only on Day One if he wins", NY Times "Trump says he wouldn't be a dictator, except on day one", USA Today "Trump says he will be a dictator only on day one." Some editors believe Trump didn't say exactly that and this statement shouldn't be included and/or the article should ignore this topic entirely. '''QUESTION: Should the article state, as claimed by reliable sources, that Trump said he'd be a dictator on day one of his presidency, and discuss the wider topic of Trump and dictatorship, which has been extensively covered in reliable sources?''' [[Special:Contributions/67.82.74.5|67.82.74.5]] ([[User talk:67.82.74.5|talk]]) 01:00, 8 December 2023 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia talk:Biographies of living persons#rfc_888174C|Wikipedia talk:Biographies of living persons]] expired 2024-01-07 20:01 ===
* Id: 888174C
* User: Novo Tape
* Date: 2023-12-08 19:06:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|1188959671|BIO 1188959671}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|1188959679|POLICY 1188959679}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|1194205227|BIO 1194205227}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|1194205232|POLICY 1194205232}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Should the wording of [[WP:BDP]] be
#... the policy can extend '''based on editorial consensus''' [emphasis mine] for an indeterminate period beyond the date of death‚Äîsix months, one year, two years at the outside. '''''Such extensions only apply to contentious or questionable material'''''...
#... the policy can extend for an indeterminate period beyond the date of death‚Äîsix months, one year, two years at the outside. Such extensions would apply particularly to contentious or questionable material...
#... the policy would extend for ''[six months/one year/two years]'' beyond the date of death. Such an extension would apply in particular to contentious or questionable material about the subject that has implications for their living relatives and friends, such as in the case of a possible suicide or particularly gruesome crime. After ''[six months/one year/two years]'', the policy may be extended further based upon editorial consensus.
[[User:Novo Tape|<span style="color:#0645AD"> Sincerely, Novo Tape (She/Her)</span>]]<sup>[[User talk:Novo Tape|<span style="color:#0645AD">My Talk Page</span>]]</sup>  19:06, 8 December 2023 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Israel#rfc_EA42CF1|Talk:Israel]] expired 2024-01-09 18:01 ===
* Id: EA42CF1
* User: Nableezy
* Date: 2023-12-10 17:22:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1189248975|POL 1189248975}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1194575158|POL 1194575158}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Should the sentence {{tq| Israel's practices, in the longest military occupation in modern history, have drawn international condemnation for violating the human rights of Palestinians.}} be changed to any of the following options:
*'''Option 1''' - no change
*'''Option 2''' - {{tq|Israel's practices in its occupation of the Palestinian territories have drawn sustained international criticism along with accusations that it has committed war crimes and crimes against humanity against the Palestinian people from human rights organizations and United Nations officials.}}
*'''Option 3''' - {{tq|Israel's actions in its occupation of the Palestinian territories have drawn international criticism from the United Nations.}}
*'''Option 4''' - {{tq|Israel's policies and actions on the occupied Palestinian territories have drawn international criticism for violating the human rights of Palestinians, along with accusations that it has committed war crimes and crimes against humanity by human rights organizations and UN officials.}} 
*'''Option 5''' - remove entirely
'''[[User talk:Nableezy|<span style="color:#C11B17;font-size:90%">nableezy</span>]]''' -  17:22, 10 December 2023 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia:Requests for coment/Names of deceased trans people#rfc_2DE3507|Wikipedia:Requests for coment/Names of deceased trans people]] expired 2024-01-09 19:01 ===
* Id: 2DE3507
* Date: 2023-12-10 18:38:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|1191183103|BIO 1191183103}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_style_and_naming|prev|1192257033|STYLE 1192257033}}

** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|1194584394|POLICY 1194584394}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Should the following be added to [[MOS:DEADNAME]]?

{{tqb|For deceased transgender or non-binary persons, their former name (birth name, professional name, stage name, or pseudonym) should be included in their main biographical article only if the name is documented in multiple [[WP:SECONDARY|secondary]] and [[WP:RS|reliable sources]] containing non-trivial coverage of the person.}}

For pre-RFC discussions on this proposal, see:
#[[Wikipedia talk:Manual of Style/Biography#Deadnames of the deceased ‚Äì yet again]]
#[[Wikipedia talk:Manual of Style/Biography/2023 archive#Proposal to split MOS:GENDERID from Wikipedia:Manual of Style/Biography]]
#[[Wikipedia talk:Manual of Style/Biography/2023 archive#WP:BOLD restrictions on the use of deceased transgender or non-binary persons birth name or former name]]

This text was added [[WP:BOLD|boldly]] by different editors, originally {{diff2|1166225448|in July}} and again {{diff2|1180519436|in October}}, but was removed {{diff2|1187874101|in December}}. 18:38, 10 December 2023 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia talk:Criteria for speedy deletion#rfc_5FCEA0C|Wikipedia talk:Criteria for speedy deletion]] expired 2024-01-11 16:01 ===
* Id: 5FCEA0C
* Date: 2023-12-12 15:32:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|1189557180|POLICY 1189557180}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_proposals|prev|1189557185|PROP 1189557185}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|1194949716|POLICY 1194949716}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_proposals|prev|1194949718|PROP 1194949718}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Which of these options is preferred for the status of CSD G5?
* '''Option 1''': Keep G5 as is.
* '''Option 2''': Add mention of general sanctions to G5.
* '''Option 3''': Add general sanctions violations to its own speedy criterion.
* '''Option 4''': Repeal G5 and incorporate its principles into the [[WP:BANPOL]] (specifically [[WP:BANREVERT]]) as "administrators are permitted, but are not required, to delete page creations made in violation of a ban, general sanction, or block".
* '''Option 5''': Repeal G5 and do nothing else.
* '''Something else?'''
[[User:Awesome Aasim|Awesome]] [[User_talk:Awesome Aasim|Aasim]] 15:32, 12 December 2023 (UTC)}}

'''A'''. '''Lucy Letby''' (born 4 January 1990) is a British [[serial killer]] and former [[neonatal nurse]] convicted of the murder of seven infants and attempted murder of six others between June 2015 and June 2016.

=== [[Wikipedia:Village pump (policy)#rfc_66B83ED|Wikipedia:Village pump (policy)]] expired 2024-01-21 14:01 ===
* Id: 66B83ED
* User: Szmenderowiecki
* Date: 2023-12-22 13:27:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|1191265925|POLICY 1191265925}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|1197676969|POLICY 1197676969}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Currently, [[WP:PGCHANGE]] says this: {{tq|After some time, if there are no objections to the change and/or if a widespread consensus for your change or implementation is reached through discussion, you can then edit policy and guideline pages describing the practice to reflect the new situation.}}

Should [[WP:PGCHANGE]] include an explanation, or else clarify the meaning of "widespread consensus" to mean the following:

{{tq|For the purpose of this policy, "widespread consensus for the change" means that the discussion about substantive changes to a policy or guideline must be advertised sitewide to the entire community (such as through a [[WP:RFC|request for comment]] and/or by posting at [[WP:CENT|centralized discussion]]) and, after being so advertised, would reach consensus for the change.}}

It need not be the exact wording, but this would be the intended meaning. The possibility to edit policies and guidelines if there are no objections to these changes will stay. [[User:Szmenderowiecki|Szmenderowiecki]] ([[User talk:Szmenderowiecki|talk]]) 13:27, 22 December 2023 (UTC)}}

Should allegations of genocide be mentioned in the lead? There are four options in my mind. {{Ordered list |list_style_type=upper-alpha

|Mention that Israel is accused of genocide. 

|Mention that Hamas is accused of genocide. 

|Mention that Israel and Hamas are both accused of genocide. 

|Make no mention of genocide at all. }} [[User:JDiala|JDiala]] ([[User talk:JDiala|talk]]) 08:57, 2 January 2024 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:93rd Academy Awards#rfc_54F34B3|Talk:93rd Academy Awards]] expired 2024-01-23 21:01 ===
* Id: 54F34B3
* User: 2601:249:9301:D570:899A:E22B:2167:7F2C
* Date: 2024-01-23 19:55:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|1198314215|MEDIA 1198314215}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|1198330565|MEDIA 1198330565}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Due to the odd number of award categories, they don't neatly fit into the two columns per row. The current format of the final row for this page is the following:

{| role="presentation" class=wikitable
|-
| style="vertical-align:top; width:50%;"| {{Award category|#eedd82|[[Academy Award for Best Visual Effects|Best Visual Effects]]}}
* '''''[[Tenet (film)|Tenet]]''&nbsp;‚Äì [[Scott R. Fisher]], [[Andrew Jackson (visual effects)|Andrew Jackson]], [[David Lee (visual effects artist)|David Lee]] and [[Andrew Lockley]]'''{{double dagger}}
** ''[[Love and Monsters (film)|Love and Monsters]]''&nbsp;‚Äì [[Genevieve Camilleri]], [[Brian Cox (special effects artist)|Brian Cox]], [[Matt Everitt (animator)|Matt Everitt]] and [[Matt Sloan (visual effects)|Matt Sloan]]
** ''[[The Midnight Sky]]''&nbsp;‚Äì [[Matt Kasmir]], [[Chris Lawrence (visual effects)|Chris Lawrence]], [[Max Solomon]] and [[David Watkins (special effects artist)|David Watkins]]
** ''[[Mulan (2020 film)|Mulan]]''&nbsp;‚Äì [[Sean Andrew Faden]], [[Steve Ingram]], [[Anders Langlands]] and [[Seth Maury]]
** ''[[The One and Only Ivan (film)|The One and Only Ivan]]''&nbsp;‚Äì [[Nick Davis (visual effects supervisor)|Nick Davis]], Greg Fisher, Ben Jones and [[Santiago Colomo Mart√≠nez]]
| style="vertical-align:top; width:50%;"|
|}

However, the style used by other pages for the Academy Awards use this format:

{| role="presentation" class=wikitable
|-
| colspan="2" style="vertical-align:top; width:50%;"| {{Award category|#eedd82|[[Academy Award for Best Visual Effects|Best Visual Effects]]}}
* '''''[[Tenet (film)|Tenet]]''&nbsp;‚Äì [[Scott R. Fisher]], [[Andrew Jackson (visual effects)|Andrew Jackson]], [[David Lee (visual effects artist)|David Lee]] and [[Andrew Lockley]]'''{{double dagger}}
** ''[[Love and Monsters (film)|Love and Monsters]]''&nbsp;‚Äì [[Genevieve Camilleri]], [[Brian Cox (special effects artist)|Brian Cox]], [[Matt Everitt (animator)|Matt Everitt]] and [[Matt Sloan (visual effects)|Matt Sloan]]
** ''[[The Midnight Sky]]''&nbsp;‚Äì [[Matt Kasmir]], [[Chris Lawrence (visual effects)|Chris Lawrence]], [[Max Solomon]] and [[David Watkins (special effects artist)|David Watkins]]
** ''[[Mulan (2020 film)|Mulan]]''&nbsp;‚Äì [[Sean Andrew Faden]], [[Steve Ingram]], [[Anders Langlands]] and [[Seth Maury]]
** ''[[The One and Only Ivan (film)|The One and Only Ivan]]''&nbsp;‚Äì [[Nick Davis (visual effects supervisor)|Nick Davis]], Greg Fisher, Ben Jones and [[Santiago Colomo Mart√≠nez]]
|}

It's been argued that the latter format places undue weight on the category by implying that it's more significant, but it also been stated that the former is inconsistent with the other Academy Award ceremonies pages. Which format should be used?[[Special:Contributions/2601:249:9301:D570:899A:E22B:2167:7F2C|2601:249:9301:D570:899A:E22B:2167:7F2C]] ([[User talk:2601:249:9301:D570:899A:E22B:2167:7F2C|talk]]) 19:55, 23 January 2024 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia talk:Naming conventions (television)#rfc_3B80989|Wikipedia talk:Naming conventions (television)]] expired 2024-01-26 22:01 ===
* Id: 3B80989
* User: Steel1943
* Date: 2024-01-18 20:01:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_style_and_naming|prev|1196906353|STYLE 1196906353}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_style_and_naming|prev|1208503194|STYLE 1208503194}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Both disambiguators "(serial)" and "(TV serial)" are in titles for various articles, see a [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?go=Go&search=intitle%3A%2FTV+%5BSs%5Derial%5C%29%2F&title=Special%3ASearch&ns0=1 title search for "(TV serial)"] and a [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?search=intitle%3A%2F%5B%5EVv%5D%5B+%5C%28%5D%5BSs%5Derial%5C%29%2F&title=Special:Search&profile=advanced&fulltext=1&ns0=1 title search for "(serial)"] for reference. In the NCTV guideline's current state, the mentioned use is "(serial)", but most articles which are located at titles with "(serial)" instead of "(TV serial)" seem to be about film serials, and actually pertain to title conventions that are covered by [[WP:NCFILM]].

So, in regards to TV serials, which disambiguator should be the standard? [[User:Steel1943|<span style="color: #3F00FF;">'''''Steel1943'''''</span>]] ([[User talk:Steel1943|talk]]) 20:01, 18 January 2024 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia talk:WikiProject Elements#rfc_8C8614B|Wikipedia talk:WikiProject Elements]] expired 2024-01-28 07:01 ===
* Id: 8C8614B
* User: LaundryPizza03
* Date: 2023-12-29 06:56:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|1192419932|SCI 1192419932}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_style_and_naming|prev|1192419938|STYLE 1192419938}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|1199901166|SCI 1199901166}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_style_and_naming|prev|1199901173|STYLE 1199901173}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Should the following inclusion criteria be adopted for the tables of [[isotope]]s in element infoboxes?
{{tqb|
Element infoboxes and the heads of the coresponding lists of isotopes should include a short table of isotopes that satisfy at least one of the following properties:
# [[Primordial nuclide]]s
# [[Cosmogenic nuclide]]s and naturally occurring decay products
# Nuclides used in [[nuclear medicine]], in industry, or as [[radioactive tracer]]s
# [[Nuclear fuel]]s and [[fission product]]s
# [[Extinct radionuclide]]s
# The three longest-lived isotopes of a [[synthetic element]]
# Most commonly produced isotopes of a [[synthetic element]]
# Other interesting nuclides, such as [[beryllium-8]]
}}
For reference, the isotope tables look like this:
{{User:LaundryPizza03/Main isotopes RfC}}
‚Äì[[User:LaundryPizza03|<b style="color:#77b">Laundry</b><b style="color:#fb0">Pizza</b><b style="color:#b00">03</b>]] ([[User talk:LaundryPizza03|<span style="color:#0d0">d</span>]][[Special:Contribs/LaundryPizza03|<span style="color:#0bf">cÃÑ</span>]]) 06:56, 29 December 2023 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Banu Fazara#rfc_DE9C265|Talk:Banu Fazara]] expired 2024-01-30 15:01 ===
* Id: DE9C265
* User: 2A00:801:707:AFAE:FC02:57DA:9BB7:8E6E
* Date: 2024-01-18 23:08:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|1196960912|HIST 1196960912}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Religion_and_philosophy|prev|1196960920|RELI 1196960920}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|1200928102|HIST 1200928102}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Religion_and_philosophy|prev|1200928135|RELI 1200928135}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Do you find this phrase acceptable?

I discussed with @[[User:Adakiko|Adakiko]] about adding a point of view denying this incident.
Discussion above here [[Talk:Banu_Fazara#Religious_sources]]. 

Please read the discussion between us so that you have an idea about the topic.

I believe that the article cannot be left as it is so that the reader thinks that the incident is a historical fact. Especially since it is considered unreliable according to the rules of Islamic [[hadith studies]]. But the criticisms written by Muslims about it are mostly found in forums, blogs, or Facebook. Which cannot be considered as sources on the wiki. 
And according to wiki policy, original research cannot be published. 

But I found [[Islamqa.info]] (a website that specializes in Islamic religious sciences and answers questions that come to it from Muslims and others) publishing a criticism in which it denies that incident and clarifies that it is not proven according to the rules of Islamic hadith science. But there is no consensus among wiki editors that the site is considered a reliable source. I suggest that the phrase ((the Islamqa.info website, which is supervised by Sheikh Muhammad Saleh Al-Munajjid, denies the incident)) be written as a consensus phrase. 

[[User:Adakiko|Adakiko]] suggested that I start [[wp:RfC]].

Waiting for your comments. [[Special:Contributions/2A00:801:707:AFAE:FC02:57DA:9BB7:8E6E|2A00:801:707:AFAE:FC02:57DA:9BB7:8E6E]] ([[User talk:2A00:801:707:AFAE:FC02:57DA:9BB7:8E6E|talk]]) 23:08, 18 January 2024 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Sreeleela#rfc_D49C779|Talk:Sreeleela]] expired 2024-01-30 19:01 ===
* Id: D49C779
* User: Thewikizoomer
* Date: 2023-12-31 18:07:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|1192859044|BIO 1192859044}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|1201013237|BIO 1201013237}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
The subject Sreeleela happens to an American born person who was brought up in India from her childhood. She is known for her appearance in Telugu films. She is known as a Telugu film actress and not an American actress. Multiple editors appear to be disputing on whether the subject should be referred to as a Telugu-film actress, as she is known for the same or she should be referred to as an American actress just because her citizenship happens to of USA. I think it makes more sense to refer to the subject as an Indian-film actress. 

For example, if a Brazilian who was born in Brazil came to USA when they were 1 year old or so and later when they are 22 years old, they started acting in Hollywood films and are known for the same, I'd refer to them as a Hollywood actor or American film actor and not Brazilian actor right. Please correct if this is wrong. 

Should the subject be referred to as an Indian-film actress or as an American actress.

Inviting administrator and other editors comments on this matter.


Note: [[Akshay Kumar]] was a Canadian citizen until he recently renounced his Canadian citizenship and became an Indian citizen, however, even when he was a Canadian citizen, he was never referred to as a Canadian actor. [[User:Thewikizoomer|Thewikizoomer]] ([[User talk:Thewikizoomer|talk]]) 18:07, 31 December 2023 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:2023 Azerbaijani offensive in Nagorno-Karabakh#rfc_A9C5862|Talk:2023 Azerbaijani offensive in Nagorno-Karabakh]] expired 2024-02-01 11:01 ===
* Id: A9C5862
* User: Grandmaster
* Date: 2024-01-02 10:35:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|1193161077|HIST 1193161077}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1193161085|POL 1193161085}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|1201796106|HIST 1201796106}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1201796118|POL 1201796118}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Kavita Belani, [[United Nations Refugee Agency]] Representative in Armenia, stated on 29 September 2023 that "there were no recorded incidents or cases of mistreatment against people on the move". [https://www.unognewsroom.org/story/en/2020/bi-weekly-press-briefing-29-september-2023]

A UN mission that visited Nagorno-Karabakh on 1 October 2023 reported that "they did not come across any reports ‚Äî either from the local population or from others ‚Äî of violence against civilians following the latest ceasefire." [https://press.un.org/en/2023/db231002.doc.htm] 

Should the above statements by the UN missions be included in the article when discussing reports on violence against civilian population?

*'''Option 1''' - Mention these statement in the article with proper attribution.
*'''Option 2''' - Make no mention at all.

Please enter Option 1 or Option 2, followed by a brief statement, in the Survey. Do not reply to other users in the Survey. Back-and-forth discussion may be conducted in the Threaded Discussion section. [[User:Grandmaster|<span style="font-family:Arial;color:#464646">'''''Grand'''''</span>]][[User talk:Grandmaster|<span style="font-family:Arial;color:#808080">'''''master'''''</span>]] 10:35, 2 January 2024 (UTC)}}

 Should [[:File:√Ñthiopien Tabot Linden-Museum 90290.jpg]] or any image of a bare Tabot be included on this page? It has been added and removed many times, because Ethiopian Christians do not want to see uncovered tabots but the encyclopedic value is obvious. [[WP:NOTCENSORED]] tells us that {{tq|Some articles may include images, text, or links which are relevant to the topic but that some people find objectionable. Discussion of potentially objectionable content should usually focus not on its potential offensiveness but on whether it is an appropriate image, text, or link. Beyond that, "being objectionable" is generally not sufficient grounds for the removal of content.}} [[User:GordonGlottal|GordonGlottal]] ([[User talk:GordonGlottal|talk]]) 16:52, 1 February 2024 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:List of songs recorded by Rush#rfc_B95D1CF|Talk:List of songs recorded by Rush]] expired 2024-02-03 00:01 ===
* Id: B95D1CF
* User: 204.111.238.28
* Date: 2024-01-03 23:14:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|1193467723|MEDIA 1193467723}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|1202532256|MEDIA 1202532256}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
There are three questions:
#How do neutral editors here define a "song?"  Editor performing revisions insists an instrumental work is not a song, contrary to generally accepted vernacular on Wikipedia.
#If instrumentals are indeed deemed to be a "song" then are instrumental solo performances in a concert recording therefore also defined as songs, in particular when those recordings are named and tracked as such by the official song publisher on official releases?
#Conversely, if instrumentals are ultimately deemed not to be a "song" then is a wiser compromise to retitle the page so it maintains its original intent as a comprehensive list of a band's compositions, versus removing everything that doesn't fit the much narrower definition of a "song?"
[[Special:Contributions/204.111.238.28|204.111.238.28]] ([[User talk:204.111.238.28|talk]]) 23:14, 3 January 2024 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Detailed logarithmic timeline#rfc_72615EC|Talk:Detailed logarithmic timeline]] expired 2024-02-04 20:01 ===
* Id: 72615EC
* User: MrPersonHumanGuy
* Date: 2024-01-27 15:12:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|1202384549|HIST 1202384549}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|1203392604|HIST 1203392604}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
A few years ago, I had removed this sentence from the [[Detailed logarithmic timeline#Future|Future]] table, instigating a brief one-on-one dispute with another editor.<br>
For context, here's a timeline listing our actions and our arguments behind them:
* '''March 23, 2016''': [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?diff=711570074&oldid=711569925&title=Detailed_logarithmic_timeline Eric Kvaalen added "some things".]
* '''June 25, 2019''': [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Detailed_logarithmic_timeline&diff=prev&oldid=903493240 I removed "speculation about fossil fuel consumption."] (MrHumanPersonGuy was my previous account)
* '''June 29, 2019''': [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Detailed_logarithmic_timeline&diff=prev&oldid=904071466 Eric Kvaalen restored the sentence] "because [fossil fuels] will run out if we don't lower our consumption".
* '''June 30, 2019''': [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Detailed_logarithmic_timeline&diff=prev&oldid=904257091 I removed it again] with the edit summary ''"Because they'll run out" just applies to oil (2060, unless we go through our coal and gas reserves far quicklier) and assumes we won't find new reserves (on Earth or in space) to extract from or find ways to artificially synthesize them on a large scale within the next 100 years. (but we shouldn't assume we will either)''
* '''July 1, 2019''': [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Detailed_logarithmic_timeline&diff=prev&oldid=904299424 Eric Kvaalen restored it again] with the hidden note that remains to this day.
My best argument for its removal is that I believe it may constitute [[WP:OR|original research]]. However, I would like to see where consensus might stand on this matter. ‚Äì [[User:MrPersonHumanGuy|MrPersonHumanGuy]] ([[User talk:MrPersonHumanGuy|talk]]) 15:12, 27 January 2024 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia:Requests for comment/When there is no consensus either way#rfc_7DAD6AD|Wikipedia:Requests for comment/When there is no consensus either way]] expired 2024-02-05 03:01 ===
* Id: 7DAD6AD
* User: WhatamIdoing
* Date: 2024-01-06 02:40:00

* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
When editors are unable to form a consensus ''either way'' about including or excluding a particular fact in a Wikipedia article, should they default to including or excluding that fact?  (This question is ''not'' about living persons.)  [[User:WhatamIdoing|WhatamIdoing]] ([[User talk:WhatamIdoing|talk]]) 02:40, 6 January 2024 (UTC)}}

** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|1203600253|MEDIA 1203600253}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Should the material under the [[Peter Schiff#Investigation, Exoneration, and Lawsuit|Investigation, Exoneration, and Lawsuit]] subheading be edited so that it reads as below, which is as per the edit at [[Special:Diff/1193525256]], such that this becomes the established consensus for this section until such time that alternative consensus is established?

"On June 30, 2022, the Puerto Rico Office of the Commissioner of Financial Institutions (OCIF) announced they had suspended the operations of Puerto Rico-based Euro Pacific International Bank, which officials said was under suspicion of facilitating money laundering and offshore tax evasion.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://apnews.com/article/caribbean-money-laundering-puerto-rico-san-juan-efb421edca78f0d477c665d346658373|title=Puerto Rico suspends operations of bank amid global probe|newspaper=AP News|date=June 30, 2022|last1=Coto|first1=D√°nica}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web |last=Nick |first=McKenzie |last2=Charlotte |first2=Grieve |last3=Tozer |first3=Joel |date=2020-10-18 |title=Westpac, mint, hundreds of Australians ensnared in global tax evasion probe |url=https://www.theage.com.au/national/westpac-mint-hundreds-of-australians-ensnared-in-global-tax-evasion-probe-20201015-p565la.html |access-date=2024-01-03 |website=The Age |language=en}}</ref> The OCIF ordered Euro Pacific Bank to be shut down due to insufficient capitol. In a latter settlement the regulators acknowledged the bank did have sufficient cash at hand.<ref name="Robles-2022" /> Schiff claimed the OCIF actions were due to the allegations by [[60_Minutes_(Australian_TV_program)|60 Minutes Australia]], [[The Age]] newspaper, and the subsequent investigations, saying, "There was no way those allegations were true, but once those stories broke, the bank's business imploded".<ref name="Robles-2022">{{Cite news |last=Robles |first=Frances |date=9 August 2022 |title=Peter Schiff Has a Deal With Puerto Rico to Liquidate His Euro Pacific Bank, He Says |language=en-US |website=[[The New York Times]] |url=https://www.nytimes.com/2022/08/09/business/euro-pacific-peter-schiff.html |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20231229032633/https://www.nytimes.com/2022/08/09/business/euro-pacific-peter-schiff.html |archive-date=29 December 2023 |access-date=4 October 2022}}</ref> Operation Atlantis yielded no charges of money laundering or any other illegal activity.<ref name="Robles-2022" /> In 2022 Schiff filed civil action against the [[Nine Entertainment|Nine Network]] and The Age newspaper for defamation over the Australian 60 Minutes interview and subsequent Age articles.<ref name="Goldstein-2023">{{Cite web |last=Goldstein |first=Matthew |date=1 December 2023 |title=Australian Media Company to Pay Peter Schiff to End Defamation Suit |url=https://www.nytimes.com/2023/12/01/business/peter-schiff-defamation-settlement-nine.html |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20231208120430/https://www.nytimes.com/2023/12/01/business/peter-schiff-defamation-settlement-nine.html |archive-date=8 December 2023 |access-date=8 December 2023 |website=[[The New York Times]]}}</ref> On November 21 the civil action was settled.<ref name="Goldstein-2023" /> As part of the settlement, Schiff was paid more than $360,000 by Nine Networks and The Age, and all versions of the broadcast were permanently removed by the respondents.<ref name="Goldstein-2023" />"

Additionally should the subheading be adjusted such that it reads "Investigation and Lawsuit" instead of "Investigation, Exoneration, and Lawsuit"? ''[[User:TarnishedPath|<b style="color:#ff0000;">Tar</b><b style="color:#ff7070;">nis</b><b style="color:#ffa0a0;">hed</b><b style="color:#420000;">Path</b>]]''<sup>[[User talk:TarnishedPath|<b style="color:#bd4004;">talk</b>]]</sup> 05:11, 6 January 2024 (UTC)}}

The article currently has the following material at the bottom of the [[Nick McKenzie#Court cases and shield laws]] section:

"In 2023, the Nine Network settled a defamation lawsuit involving [[Peter Schiff]] after an Australian judge found that Nick McKenzie's 60 Minutes story about an international law enforcement operation, Atlantis, targeting his offshore bank, had defamed Schiff. As part of the settlement, Schiff was paid $550,000 and all versions of the broadcast were permanently removed by the respondents.<ref>{{Cite web |last=Goldstein |first=Matthew |date=1 December 2023 |title=Australian Media Company to Pay Peter Schiff to End Defamation Suit |url=https://www.nytimes.com/2023/12/01/business/peter-schiff-defamation-settlement-nine.html |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20231208120430/https://www.nytimes.com/2023/12/01/business/peter-schiff-defamation-settlement-nine.html |archive-date=8 December 2023 |access-date=8 December 2023 |website=[[The New York Times]]}}</ref> <ref>{{Cite web |last=Dudley |first=Ellie |date=May 19, 2023 |title=Bank boss Peter Schiff has 'all but won' Nine defamation case, court hears |url=https://www.theaustralian.com.au/nation/bank-boss-peter-schiff-has-all-but-won-nine-defamation-case-court-hears/news-story/120421e466c12eda69ed75e5cc1e4c4f?amp |website=The Australian}}</ref>"

=== [[Talk:International Churches of Christ#rfc_20CFE33|Talk:International Churches of Christ]] expired 2024-02-09 16:01 ===
* Id: 20CFE33
* User: Cordless Larry
* Date: 2024-01-10 15:35:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Religion_and_philosophy|prev|1194756645|RELI 1194756645}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|1194756650|SOC 1194756650}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Religion_and_philosophy|prev|1205409312|RELI 1205409312}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|1205409317|SOC 1205409317}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
At [[International Churches of Christ#Court cases and lawsuits]], the article currently states: {{tq|The Central Christian Church in Singapore, a part of the ICOC family of churches,{{cn|date=January 2024}} won a court case (SINGAPORE HIGH COURT ‚Äì SUIT NOs 846 and 848 of 1992 Judges LAI KEW CHAI J Date 29 August 1994 Citation [1995] 1 SLR 115) in which the judge ruled against a newspaper that had accused the Church of being a cult.{{citation needed|date=September 2023}} An expert on religious studies testified that the Central Christian Church's practices were "neither strange, unnatural or harmful."<ref>{{cite web|url=http://newspapers.nl.sg/Digitised/SearchResults.aspx?keyword=central%20christian%20church%20hearings |title=NewspaperSG |work=nl.sg |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20130928102343/http://newspapers.nl.sg/Digitised/SearchResults.aspx?keyword=central%20christian%20church%20hearings |archive-date=28 September 2013 |url-status=dead |df=dmy-all }}</ref>}} The link between the Central Christian Church and the ICOC is supported by [https://icochistory.org/download/la-story-courage-under-fire/?wpdmdl=754&refresh=659b9831268ab1704695857 this] primary source, provided by {{u|JamieBrown2011}} in the discussion above.

The questions for the RfC are (a) whether the sourcing (including the primary source linking the Singapore church to the ICOC) is strong enough for this to be included and if so, (b) what the appropriate weight is to give this case and (c) whether it should be added to the article lede. [[User:Cordless Larry|Cordless Larry]] ([[User talk:Cordless Larry|talk]]) 15:35, 10 January 2024 (UTC)}}

{{rfcquote|text=
The [[#World Christian Encyclopedia and World Religion Database/World Christian Database]] are currently used in many Wikipedia articles (cf. [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?limit=500&offset=0&profile=default&search=insource%3A%22thearda.com%22&title=Special:Search&ns0=1 1], [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?limit=500&offset=0&profile=default&search=insource%3A%22gordonconwell.edu%22&title=Special:Search&ns0=1 2], [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?search=insource%3A%22worldreligiondatabase.org%22&title=Special:Search&ns0=1 3], [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?search=insource%3A%22worldchristiandatabase.org%22&title=Special:Search&ns0=1 4]) to cite statistics on religion demography, and finding a consensus on the reliability of these sources in the discussion above has been difficult. Foregoing discussions on the same sources include [[Wikipedia:Reliable_sources/Noticeboard/Archive_239#thearda.com|one in 2018]] and [[Wikipedia:Reliable_sources/Noticeboard/Archive_395#Association_of_Religion_Data_Archives_and_World_Religion_Database|one in 2022-2023 (with RfC)]].

In this request for comment, it is possible to:

* '''Option 0:''' Express a comment without choosing any specific option on the reliability of the sources.
* Assess the reliability of the sources by choosing from one of the following options:
** '''Option 1: [[WP:GREL|Generally reliable]]'''
** '''Option 2: [[WP:MREL|Additional considerations]]'''
** '''Option 3: [[WP:GUNREL|Generally unreliable]]'''
** '''Option 4: [[WP:DEPREC|Deprecate]]'''

[[User:√Üo|√Üo]] ([[User talk:√Üo|talk]]) 18:06, 10 January 2024 (UTC)}}


=== [[Wikipedia:Reliable sources/Noticeboard#rfc_CF005FE|Wikipedia:Reliable sources/Noticeboard]] expired 2024-02-09 18:01 ===
* Id: CF005FE
* User: √Üo
* Date: 2024-01-10 17:30:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|1194776595|HIST 1194776595}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Religion_and_philosophy|prev|1194776602|RELI 1194776602}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|1194776606|SOC 1194776606}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1195226866|POL 1195226866}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|1205451471|HIST 1205451471}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1205451478|POL 1205451478}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Religion_and_philosophy|prev|1205451484|RELI 1205451484}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|1205451490|SOC 1205451490}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
The [[#Operation World, Joshua Project and Asia Harvest]] are databases of religion demographics related to the Christian missionary movement. OW and the JP are both edited by the Christian missionary Patrick Johnstone, while AH, which reproduces OW-JP statistics for Asia and China, is edited by the Christian missionary Paul Hattaway. The JP has been the subject of more than ten discussions on this noticeboard, with almost all comments finding it completely unreliable. The latest [[Wikipedia:Reliable_sources/Noticeboard/Archive_361#RfC:_Joshua_Project|discussion with RfC in 2021]] decided its inclusion in the perennial sources' list as a generally unreliable source. Despite this, it is still widely used throughout Wikipedia (cf. [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?limit=500&offset=0&profile=default&search=insource%3A%22joshuaproject.net%22&title=Special:Search&ns0=1 1]), and its associated projects OW and AH are also widely used (cf. [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Special:Search&limit=500&offset=0&ns0=1&search=insource%3A%22operationworld.org%22 3], [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Special:Search&limit=500&offset=0&ns0=1&search=insource%3A%22asiaharvest.org%22 4]), and this was already a matter of complaint in the previous discussions.

Should the JP, and its associated projects OW and AH, be [[WP:DEPRECATED]]? Answer '''yes''' or '''no'''.

[[User:√Üo|√Üo]] ([[User talk:√Üo|talk]]) 17:30, 10 January 2024 (UTC)}}

*'''Comment''': A statement from the Algerian Foreign Minister, at the United Nations, about the two state solution, being made at a time when this issue is at the forefront of international concern, is a meaningful addition to an article about Algerian-Israeli relations. I added a secondary source to the existing primary source. It passes WEIGHT. <span style="font-family:Courier;"><b>&nbsp;//&nbsp;[[User:TimothyBlue|Timothy]]&nbsp;::&nbsp;[[User talk:TimothyBlue|talk]]&nbsp;</b></span> 05:29, 11 February 2024 (UTC)}}

Should we change the text in the {{para|result}} parameter of the infobox from the present wording:

{{tq|See {{section link||Result}}}}

to the following (or [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=2023_Ukrainian_counteroffensive&diff=prev&oldid=1191261266 something similar]):?

{{tq|Operational failure{{efn|Russian
 forces thwart the offensive operationally and defend the cities, but suffer logistical setbacks in
 Crimea.}}<br />For more details, see {{section link||Result}}}}

=== [[Talk:Ryanair#rfc_A32356D|Talk:Ryanair]] expired 2024-02-16 08:01 ===
* Id: A32356D
* User: Lard Almighty
* Date: 2024-01-17 07:29:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|1208015245|SCI 1208015245}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Two editors are having a dispute about the order in which the MAX 200 (a derivation of the MAX-8) and the MAX 10 should appear in the list.

One wants to list them in numerical order based on 200, the other based on 8.

Generally, manufacturers number aircraft types in chronological order of first production. One interesting exception is the Boeing 717 which post-dates the every Boeing aircraft except the 787. However, it is [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Boeing_Commercial_Airplanes#Orders_and_deliveries listed in numerical order in the list of Boeing aircraft] rather than date of first flight.

So the question here is which should we do here? Do we list in chronological order of first flight or in strict numerical order (given that the MAX 200, while a derivative of the MAX 8, is a separate model)? Another option would be to list by order of date that Ryanair ordered each model.[[User:Lard Almighty|Lard Almighty]] ([[User talk:Lard Almighty|talk]]) 07:29, 17 January 2024 (UTC)}}

** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|1197554333|HIST 1197554333}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|1197554342|SCI 1197554342}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|1209038220|HIST 1209038220}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|1209038223|SCI 1209038223}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Are more general descriptions of climates acceptable on city/region climate sections if climate classification systems conflict?

Three options come to mind here:

* Option 1: Climate descriptions '''should not''' be generalized, even when classifications conflict. This leads to the structure given below being the only acceptable description:

Budapest has a [[Humid subtropical climate|humid subtropical]] ([[K√∂ppen climate classification|K√∂ppen]]: ''Cfa'') or [[Oceanic climate|oceanic]] ([[Trewartha climate classification|Trewartha]]: ''Doa'') climate.

* Option 2a: Climate descriptions '''could''' be generalized, but this should be kept to  cases where intractable disputes form due to wording and/or climate type (see [[Talk:Budapest#Climate]] for example); therefore the structure given below would also be acceptable in certain circumstances:

Budapest has a [[humid temperate climate]] ([[K√∂ppen climate classification|K√∂ppen]]: ''Cfa'', [[Trewartha climate classification|Trewartha]]: ''Doa'').<sup>1</sup>

* Option 2b: Much like 2a,  but without the dispute requirement. Climate types '''could''' be generalized '''at will''' as long as climate classifications conflict.


<sup>1</sup> Keep in mind that both K√∂ppen and Trewartha place Budapest into a climate class within the scope of a [[humid temperate climate]] (humid subtropical and oceanic respectively). For some cities, the category might need to be broader; [[Portland, Oregon]] would simply have a [[temperate climate]] under this scheme, as that is the first level of intersection between Mediterranean and oceanic climates. Despite this, within the rules of [[K√∂ppen climate classification|K√∂ppen]] and [[Trewartha climate classification|Trewartha]], a point of ''no'' overlap is mathematically impossible; and it is vanishingly rare to see another classification besides these two on a city page.

[[User:Uness232|Uness232]] ([[User talk:Uness232|talk]]) 00:27, 21 January 2024 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia:Village pump (proposals)#rfc_0F78D91|Wikipedia:Village pump (proposals)]] expired 2024-02-20 09:01 ===

* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Should the [[Wikipedia:Requests for adminship|requests for adminship]] process be placed under [[Wikipedia:General sanctions|community sanctions]] (GS)? [[user:theleekycauldron|theleekycauldron]] ([[User talk:Theleekycauldron|talk]] ‚Ä¢ she/her) 20:05, 14 February 2024 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia:Village pump (proposals)#rfc_7304137|Wikipedia:Village pump (proposals)]] expired 2024-02-20 09:01 ===
* Id: 7304137
* User: SilkTork
* Date: 2024-02-18 11:33:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_proposals|prev|1208664418|PROP 1208664418}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_proposals|prev|1209101549|PROP 1209101549}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Following the trial of the discussion-first RfA (provided the proposal is enacted), a second trial of threaded-discussion RfA will run for six months or 5 Requests for Adminship (RFAs) which are not closed as SNOW or NOTNOW, whichever happens sooner. A RfC to then be set up to see if elements of either or both trials should be made permanent. In the no threaded-discussion RfA trial, the rules and procedures are to be followed normally, except that, other than 'Crats, nobody is allowed to comment below another user's vote or comment. Each user, including the candidate, may address issues or respond to other comments either after their own vote comment, or by creating their own sub-section in the General comments area. [[User:SilkTork|SilkTork]] ([[User talk:SilkTork|talk]]) 11:33, 18 February 2024 (UTC)}}


=== [[Wikipedia:Village pump (proposals)#rfc_C8F9654|Wikipedia:Village pump (proposals)]] expired 2024-02-20 09:01 ===
* Id: C8F9654
* Date: 2024-02-17 17:49:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_proposals|prev|1208479972|PROP 1208479972}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_proposals|prev|1209101549|PROP 1209101549}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Following the passage of this RfC, for 5 Requests for Adminship (RFAs) which are not closed as SNOW or NOTNOW (or for six months, whichever happens first), RfAs will last 10 days. For the first 3 days (72 hours) no "Support", "Oppose", or "Neutral" comments/!votes may be made. Optional questions may still be asked and answered, and general comments may still be left. After 3 days, "Support", "Oppose", and "Neutral" !votes may be left for the remaining 7 days (same length as an RfA is now). This RfC does not change other RfA procedures/rules. 17:49, 17 February 2024 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia:Reliable sources/Noticeboard#rfc_9814CBC|Wikipedia:Reliable sources/Noticeboard]] expired 2024-02-21 08:01 ===
* Id: 9814CBC
* User: Chess
* Date: 2024-01-24 18:15:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Economy,_trade,_and_companies|prev|1198665489|ECON 1198665489}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|1198665494|SCI 1198665494}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|1198665501|MEDIA 1198665501}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Economy,_trade,_and_companies|prev|1209824942|ECON 1209824942}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|1209824947|SCI 1209824947}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|1209824950|MEDIA 1209824950}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
 
What is the reliability of sites owned by [[Red Ventures]] (excluding specific sites listed below)?

* '''Option 1: [[WP:GREL|Generally reliable]]'''
* '''Option 2: [[WP:MREL|Additional considerations]]'''
* '''Option 3: [[WP:GUNREL|Generally unreliable]]'''
* '''Option 4: [[WP:DEPREC|Deprecate]]'''

This proposal came up at a recent discussion of [[ZDNet]] [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Wikipedia:Reliable_sources/Noticeboard&oldid=1196942065#Something_strange_is_going_on_with_ZDNet]. While Red Ventures itself has been infrequently discussed [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wikipedia:Reliable_sources/Noticeboard/Archive_398#Red_Ventures%27s_portfolio] prior to this RfC, sites now owned by it have been frequently discussed in the past, such as [[CNET]], [[ZDNet]], [[Healthline]], and others. For the purposes of keeping this RfC clear due to Red Ventures' enormous reach, this applies to content published by sites during the period of time they were owned by Red Ventures, so pre-acquisition content would be exempt. This RfC also excludes the following sources as they were previously discussed at [[WP:RSP]]:
* [[WP:CNET]], [[WP:MREL]] since being acquired by Red Ventures in October 2020, unreliable after November 2022
* [[WP:HEALTHLINE]], deprecated
* [[The Points Guy]], blacklisted and split between [[WP:MREL]] and [[WP:GUNREL]].
It also excludes sources sold by Red Ventures in 2022 to Fandom as they were identified in the previous discussion as possibly needing an exception due to frequent use/not spending that much time under Red Ventures. Examples include [[Metacritic]], [[TV Guide]], and [[Gamespot]] (which are considered generally reliable at [[WP:RSP]] and [[WP:GAMESOURCES]]). However, this RfC would apply to [[ZDNet]] and [[Lonely Planet]] as of the time they were acquired by Red Ventures. <span class="nowrap">[[User:Chess|Chess]] ([[User talk:Chess|talk]]) <small>(please [[Help:Talk pages#Notifications|mention]] me on reply)</small></span> 18:15, 24 January 2024 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Genital modification and mutilation#rfc_9FA942A|Talk:Genital modification and mutilation]] expired 2024-02-25 09:01 ===

* User: KlayCax
* Date: 2024-02-25 03:28:00

** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|1210169893|HIST 1210169893}}

{{rfcquote|text=
There's been a longtime dispute on this page on what the article should be titled. Several editors believe that the current title fails [[WP: CRITERIA]] and presents [[WP: NPOV]] issues. Others support it.

* '''Proposal A:''' Name the page "genital modification"
* '''Proposal B:''' Keep the content of the page. However, ''redirect'' the page to body modification.  
* '''Proposal C:''' Name the page "genital modification, enhancement, and mutilation" 
* '''Proposal D:''' Name the page "genital modification and enhancement" 
* '''Proposal E:''' Name the page "genital modification and mutilation" 
* '''Proposal F:''' Name the page "genital modification, enhancement, and mutilation" 
* '''Proposal G:''' Other proposal not listed above.

What proposal best fits Wikipedia's guidelines? [[User:KlayCax|KlayCax]] ([[User talk:KlayCax|talk]]) 03:28, 25 February 2024 (UTC)}}

** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_style_and_naming|prev|1210661692|STYLE 1210661692}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Which terminology is used to refer to Indian astronauts? [[User:Jeraxmoira|Jeraxmoiraüêâ]] ([[User talk:Jeraxmoira|talk]]) 13:34, 27 February 2024 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Israel‚ÄìHamas war#rfc_BE83E72|Talk:Israel‚ÄìHamas war]] expired 2024-02-29 02:01 ===
* Id: BE83E72
* User: KlayCax
* Date: 2024-02-16 17:19:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1208414946|POL 1208414946}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|1208731261|HIST 1208731261}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|1208883971|SOC 1208883971}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Economy,_trade,_and_companies|prev|1209038217|ECON 1209038217}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|1210376307|MEDIA 1210376307}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|1210941962|HIST 1210941962}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Economy,_trade,_and_companies|prev|1210941958|ECON 1210941958}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|1210941966|MEDIA 1210941966}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1210941969|POL 1210941969}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|1210941970|SOC 1210941970}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Should the lead state that Israel, Hamas, and/or the Western World is "isolated" on the world's stage? 

''If not,'' [#1]

'''Version #1:''' No mention of any of these being isolated in the lead.

''If so, what statement should be given:'' [#2-10]

'''Version #2:''' State "that Israel is isolated on the world stage."

'''Version #3:''' State "that Hamas/Palestinian militants are isolated on the world stage."

'''Version #4:''' State "that Israel and Hamas/Palestinian militants are both isolated on the world stage."

'''Version #5:''' State "that the Western World and Israel is isolated on the world stage".

'''Version #6:''' State "that the United States and Israel is isolated on the world stage."

'''Version #7:''' State the "United States, United Kingdom, and Israel are isolated on the world stage." 

'''Version #8:''' State the "United States, United Kingdom, Germany, and Israel are isolated on the world stage." 

'''Version #9:''' State "that Israel, Hamas, and the Western World are all isolated on the world stage."

'''Version #10:''' State "that Israel, Hamas, and the United States are all isolated on the world stage."

This wording has been debated on the talk page [[Talk:Israel‚ÄìHamas_war/Archive_35#"Increasing_isolation"|since late December and early January]] ‚Äî without consensus. Thank you for contributing to the discussion! [[User:KlayCax|KlayCax]] ([[User talk:KlayCax|talk]]) 17:19, 16 February 2024 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia talk:Interface administrators#rfc_DB13351|Wikipedia talk:Interface administrators]] expired 2024-02-29 03:01 ===
* Id: DB13351
* User: Xaosflux
* Date: 2024-01-30 11:23:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|1201913349|POLICY 1201913349}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|1210950398|POLICY 1210950398}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Proposed:

In: {{tq|Interface administrators who have made no edits or other logged actions for at least 2 months or who have made no edits using the permission for at least 6 months should have the user right removed.}}
*Change to {{tq|Interface administrators who have made no edits or other logged actions for at least 2 months or who have made no edits using the permission for at least <del>6 months</del><ins>12 months</ins> should have the user right removed.}}

Recent discussion: [[Special:PermaLink/1200817440]]

Proposed reasoning: interface-admin actions are not very high, but are generally productive. For editors that are still generally active, but have less frequent interface updates having them have to re-request when needed is counterproductive. We currently have [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Special:ListUsers&group=interface-admin <10 int-admins], and this change is not expected to cause us to have 'too many' as the total-inactivity threshold is still low. ‚Äî [[User:Xaosflux|<span style="color:#FF9933; font-weight:bold; font-family:monotype;">xaosflux</span>]] <sup>[[User talk:Xaosflux|<span style="color:#009933;">Talk</span>]]</sup> 11:23, 30 January 2024 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Black Irish (folklore)#rfc_5137CDA|Talk:Black Irish (folklore)]] expired 2024-03-02 04:01 ===
* Id: 5137CDA
* User: WhatamIdoing
* Date: 2024-02-01 03:57:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|1201666764|HIST 1201666764}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|1201666770|SOC 1201666770}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|1211361018|HIST 1211361018}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|1211361023|SOC 1211361023}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
The words ''Black Irish'' have been used, at different times and places, to describe:

* Irish people with "white" skin and dark hair (as contrasted with the red-headed stereotype of Celtic people), such as [[Richard Nixon]] and [[Joan Jett]].  The description was also sometimes used for people with a similar appearance, e.g., [[Elizabeth Taylor]] [https://entertainment.time.com/2013/02/27/time-cover-celebrity-showbiz/slide/elizabeth-taylor/][https://www.imdb.com/list/ls562968045/] (who was not Irish).
* Irish people with "black" skin (e.g., immigrants from sub-Saharan Africa and their descendants), such as [[Ifrah Ahmed]], [[Kwaku Fortune]], and [[Adam Idah]].

The first group (e.g., black hair, blue eyes, pale skin) is the subject of this article.  At some times and in some places, this first group's appearance has been (incorrectly) explained with a story about Spanish sailors being shipwrecked in Ireland.  This story is not true, and is fairly described as a myth.

An editor would like to have this article begin with the words "The historic term '''Black Irish''' was a [[myth]]..."  Other editors would like the article to begin with words like "The '''Black Irish''' were [[people]] of Irish ancestry, having dark hair..." or "'''Black Irish''' is a common description of the [[Human physical appearance|appearance]] of white Irish people with dark hair...", and introduce the origin myth after the group of people has been identified.

'''Question:  Should the first sentence of this article describe the Black Irish as a myth, or as people?'''  

[[User:WhatamIdoing|WhatamIdoing]] ([[User talk:WhatamIdoing|talk]]) 03:57, 1 February 2024 (UTC)}}

* User: ASmallMapleLeaf

* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|1201891251|HIST 1201891251}}

** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1211442736|POL 1211442736}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Should the current map of Somalia on this page, which does not show the areas controlled by Somaliland be replaced? If so, in what way?

* '''Option 1''': Keep current map
* ''' Option 2''': Replace current map but with a map only highlighting rough boundaries of the areas de facto controlled by Somaliland in light of the current Los Anod conflict 
*  '''Option 3''': Replace current map with a map highlighting Somaliland's de jure borders
* '''Option 4''': Show a map of Somalia with its de jure borders, while also displaying one with its de facto borders.

It's worth noting there was an edit war on this issue back in December, resulting in the current version of the map being protected. [[User:ASmallMapleLeaf|ASmallMapleLeaf]] ([[User talk:ASmallMapleLeaf|talk]]) 15:50, 1 February 2024 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia talk:Criteria for speedy deletion#rfc_442B5ED|Wikipedia talk:Criteria for speedy deletion]] expired 2024-03-03 14:01 ===
* Id: 442B5ED
* User: Thryduulf
* Date: 2024-02-02 13:34:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_proposals|prev|1206700159|PROP 1206700159}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_proposals|prev|1211614605|PROP 1211614605}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
For a while now [[WP:RFD]] has been flooded with nominations for redirects that a missing a space between the term and the opening parenthesis of a disambiguator (e.g. [[Constantine(video game)]] and [[Scaramouche(1952 film)]]), see for example sections 17 to 35 at [[Wikipedia:Redirects for discussion/Log/2024 January 31]], sections 17 to 57 at [[Wikipedia:Redirects for discussion/Log/2024 February 1]], and similar in the days leading up to them. These discussions invariably end up being deleted uncontroversially, and the number of discussions is causing issues for RfD (see e.g. [[Wikipedia talk:Redirects for discussion#Can we reduce the number of RfDs transcluded on this page?]]). Accordingly I propose a new speedy deletion criterion R5:<br>
'''Redirects with no space before a parenthetical term''', e.g. "Foo(bar)", "Joe Smith(disambiguation)". This does not apply to terms that will correctly or plausibly be searched for without spaces, e.g. [[501(c)(3)]]
*''Before'' nominating a redirect under this criterion:
**Create the correctly spaced version as a redirect to the same target if it would make a good redirect but does not exist
**Adjust any incoming internal links to point to the correctly spaced version. 
*This criterion does not apply if the redirect is the result of page move made less than 30 days ago, but criteria [[WP:CSD#R3|R3]] and/or [[WP:CSD#G6|G6]] may apply. 
The rationale for the last bullet is to allow time for mirrors, etc. to catch up. If the page was moved and then immediately moved again, or created at this title then quickly moved then this title was obviously created in error and G6 applies. [[User:Thryduulf|Thryduulf]] ([[User talk:Thryduulf|talk]]) 13:34, 2 February 2024 (UTC)}}

** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_style_and_naming|prev|1211846015|STYLE 1211846015}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
[[David Cameron]], Prime Minister of the United Kingdom from 2010 to 2016, was elevated to the [[House of Lords]] as Lord Cameron of Chipping Norton, and simultaneously appointed [[Foreign Secretary]]. Several pages refer to him as Lord Cameron of Chipping Norton. The Foreign Secretary article appears to be the only outlier in time. The title Lord Cameron of Chipping Norton was originally placed on the Foreign Secretary article but was later reverted. Should the article Foreign Secretary be reverted to display Lord Cameron of Chipping Norton's title as he is now a [[Peerage of the United Kingdom|peer]]?
[[User:TheBishopAndHolyPrince|TheBishopAndHolyPrince]] ([[User talk:TheBishopAndHolyPrince|talk]]) 12:26, 4 March 2024 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Republicanism in the United Kingdom#rfc_9FD6822|Talk:Republicanism in the United Kingdom]] expired 2024-03-06 13:01 ===
* Id: 9FD6822
* User: Hookorcrook
* Date: 2024-02-05 12:22:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1203725736|POL 1203725736}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1212168858|POL 1212168858}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
This page has seen numerous edit wars back and forth over how to display polls regarding the popularity of a republic versus monarchy. Multiple unilateral edits have been made, and the article has had to be protected several times.

The proposals so far are as follows:

*'''Option A''': Separate tables, which would see each question split into its own table, e.g. "do you want an elected head of state?" and "do you support the monarchy?"
*'''Option B''': One aggregate table, with a section outlining the differences in the question put.

Other options may be applicable too.

[[User:Hookorcrook|Hookorcrook]] ([[User talk:Hookorcrook|talk]]) 12:22, 5 February 2024 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia talk:Good article nominations#rfc_D704582|Wikipedia talk:Good article nominations]] expired 2024-03-06 13:01 ===
* Id: D704582
* User: AirshipJungleman29
* Date: 2024-02-20 04:00:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/WikiProjects_and_collaborations|prev|1209066456|PROJ 1209066456}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/WikiProjects_and_collaborations|prev|1212168860|PROJ 1212168860}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
How should the nomination categories at [[Wikipedia:Good article nominations]] be sorted?

*'''Option 1''': by age, with oldest nominations at the top of sections and newest nominations at the bottom (the pre-2023 system).
*'''Option 2''': by the nominator's ratio of reviews to nominations, with higher ratios placed at top and lower ratios at bottom (the current system, adopted after [[Wikipedia talk:Good Article proposal drive 2023#Proposal 9: Change sort order of GAN page to prioritize frequent reviewers|the proposal drive in early 2023]]).
*'''Option 3''': as at option 2, but with the ratio calculated using only reviews and nominations from within the previous 18 months (an adaptation of the current system [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Wikipedia_talk:Good_article_nominations&diff=prev&oldid=1209057911 proposed above] by [[User:Mike Christie]]).
[[User:AirshipJungleman29|&#126;~ AirshipJungleman29]] ([[User talk:AirshipJungleman29|talk]]) 04:00, 20 February 2024 (UTC)}}

In the section on Hunt's remarks on women in science made in 2015:
*1. Should a full quotation of Hunt's remarks, as is done at [[Online_shaming#Tim_Hunt_controversy]], be included?
*2. How should the event be described?
**2A: The event should be primarily described as a controversy, as well as mentioning online shaming ([https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Tim_Hunt&oldid=1202611900#Controversy example version])
**2B: The event should be primarily described as an episode of online shaming ([https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Tim_Hunt&oldid=1203604704#Controversy example version])
**2C: The event should be primarily described as a controversy with no mention of online shaming. ([https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Tim_Hunt&oldid=1203602709#Controversy example version])

=== [[Talk:List of highest-grossing live-action/animated films#rfc_819F5CF|Talk:List of highest-grossing live-action/animated films]] expired 2024-03-07 17:01 ===
* Id: 819F5CF
* User: JDDJS
* Date: 2024-02-06 16:18:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|1204204028|MEDIA 1204204028}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|1212395913|MEDIA 1212395913}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
The page says "CGI characters are only included if they are portrayed as visually distinct from their live-action surroundings‚Äîotherwise, the majority of live-action movies which use CGI visual effects would be included." However, that's a very unclear statement on what that means. I fail to see how [[Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles: Out of the Shadows]] meets that requirement, but [[Avatar (2009 film)]] and films in the MCU don't. I do think there is a distinct difference between a hybrid animation/live-action film and a live action film that uses CGI for visual effects, but I cannot think of an objective way to determine the difference. I'm hoping that someone can think of a clearer definition. <span style="color:green;">[[User:JDDJS|<span style="color:green;">JDDJS</span>]] ([[User talk:JDDJS|<span style="color:purple;">talk to me</span>]] ‚Ä¢ [[Special:Contributions/JDDJS|<span style="color:purple;">see what I've done</span>]])</span> 16:18, 6 February 2024 (UTC)}}

{{rfcquote|text=
Currently the candidates are included in infobox when polling more than 5% nationally. Relevant discussions can be found [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wikipedia_talk:WikiProject_Elections_and_Referendums/Archive_12#RfC_on_5%_threshold at this RFC in 2017] and [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wikipedia_talk:WikiProject_Elections_and_Referendums/Archive_16#RfC_on_Infoboxes:_Should_there_always_be_two_candidates? here from 2020].

Question:  What is the criteria for inclusion in  Republican primary infobox?
#(1) candidates who win a contest
#(2) candidates who get 5% of delegates
#(3) candidates who get 5% of the popular vote
#(4) a second-place finisher, even if they meet none of the other requirements.
#(5) candidates who received at least 1 delegate
#(other) please specify.

=== [[Talk:Yemen#rfc_A9FE752|Talk:Yemen]] expired 2024-03-10 16:01 ===
* Id: A9FE752
* User: Borysk5
* Date: 2024-02-09 15:16:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|1205409303|HIST 1205409303}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|1212999343|HIST 1212999343}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Following {{re|Computment}}'s comment I did a little research and found out he was indeed correct. The Yemen's size is 455,000 km2 as can be seen on this entry in Encyclopedia Britannica: [https://www.britannica.com/facts/Yemen]. I published a YT video outlining all reasons for this mistake: [https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=WNR2namiS9o link]. The mistakes I noticed impact a lot of wikipedia pages, including: [[Yemen]], [[Geography of Yemen]], [[South Yemen]], [[Yemen Arab Republic]], [[Kingdom of Yemen]], [[Geography of Yemen]], [[List of countries and dependencies by area]], [[List of Asian countries by area]], [[List of sovereign states and dependent territories in Asia]], [[Governorates of Yemen]] and probably more.

I know my video contains a lot of original research and doesnt meet wikipedia standards for a source so I decided to start a RfC and seek consensus on this topic. [[User:Borysk5|Borysk5]] ([[User talk:Borysk5|talk]]) 15:16, 9 February 2024 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Fani Willis#rfc_CB76405|Talk:Fani Willis]] expired 2024-03-11 17:01 ===
* Id: CB76405
* User: Muboshgu#top
* Date: 2024-02-10 16:33:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|1205872602|BIO 1205872602}}

* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Copied above from {{u|KiharaNoukan}}[https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?diff=1202959625] {{tq|The federal funds issue is: Willis employee Amanda Timpson reports potential misuse of federal grant funds in 2021 from colleague Michael Cuffee, saying Cuffee was proposing to spend it on Macbooks, travel, and "swag." The grant funds were intended for youth programs and gang-prevention measures. She ends up fired in 2022, sues the same year over whistleblower retaliation and racial bias. In 2023, House Judiciary investigates Willis for this and other issues, particularly whether the funding was used to prosecute Trump. In 2024, Audio of Timpson discussing misuse of funds with Willis comes out, and the House Judiciary Cmte subpoenas Willis. Willis says that this is interference from federal committees into a state case and that Timpson was fired for cause. Per AJC and above Forbes article.}}

Should allegations from Amanda Timpson be included in this article? &ndash;&nbsp;[[User:Muboshgu|Muboshgu]]&nbsp;([[User talk:Muboshgu#top|talk]]) 16:33, 10 February 2024 (UTC)}}

* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Should the leads of [[WP:DOY|Days Of the Year (DOY) articles]] be expanded to comply with [[MOS:LEADLENGTH]]/[[WP:FLCR]] or should those policies be modified to [[Wikipedia:Featured_list_candidates#February_8|create an exception]] for DOY articles per the [[Wikipedia_talk:WikiProject_Days_of_the_year#Expanding_DOY_article_leads|apparent consensus against changing DOY leads]]?

[[User:Dantheanimator|Dan]] [[User talk:Dantheanimator|the]] [[Special:Contributions/Dantheanimator|Animator]] 01:32, 11 February 2024 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia talk:Naming conventions (Korean)#rfc_96D30DF|Wikipedia talk:Naming conventions (Korean)]] expired 2024-03-15 23:01 ===
* Id: 96D30DF
* User: Toobigtokale
* Date: 2024-02-14 22:46:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Language_and_linguistics|prev|1207475936|LANG 1207475936}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_style_and_naming|prev|1207475944|STYLE 1207475944}}

** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_style_and_naming|prev|1213923412|STYLE 1213923412}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
See [[Wikipedia talk:Naming conventions (Korean)#McCune‚ÄìReischauer in titles]]. Currently, the Korean naming convention is to not use special characters for titles that use [[McCune‚ÄìReischauer]] romanization and to only use the special characters in the body. I am proposing that we allow the special characters. [[User:Toobigtokale|toobigtokale]] ([[User talk:Toobigtokale|talk]]) 22:46, 14 February 2024 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia:Reliable sources/Noticeboard#rfc_F68504B|Wikipedia:Reliable sources/Noticeboard]] expired 2024-03-21 00:01 ===
* Id: F68504B
* User: WeatherWriter
* Date: 2024-03-03 23:01:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|1211702380|HIST 1211702380}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|1211702388|MEDIA 1211702388}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1211702391|POL 1211702391}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|1216953184|HIST 1216953184}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|1216953187|MEDIA 1216953187}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1216953191|POL 1216953191}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
What is the reliability of [[OKO.press]]?

* '''Option 1: [[WP:GREL|Generally reliable]]'''
* '''Option 2: [[WP:MREL|Additional considerations]]'''
* '''Option 3: [[WP:GUNREL|Generally unreliable]]'''
* '''Option 4: [[WP:DEPREC|Deprecate]]'''

Previous RSN Discussion: [[Wikipedia:Reliable sources/Noticeboard/Archive 329#Gazeta Wyborcza and OKO.press|February 2021]] {{strikethrough|(Considered generally reliable)}} & [[Wikipedia:Reliable_sources/Noticeboard/Archive_355#RfC:_Polish_sources|October 2021]] (Considered generally reliable)

For some background, [[OKO.press]] is mentioned or cited on 129 articles across English Wikipedia. After a talk page discussion on [[Visegr√°d 24]], it was mentioned that the source may not be reliable. Given this source is cited in CTOPS articles (including [[Disinformation in the Russian invasion of Ukraine]], LGBTQ articles, and Israel-Hamas war articles), an RFC is needed to reassess reliability. '''The [[User:WeatherWriter|Weather Event Writer]]''' ([[User talk:WeatherWriter|Talk Page)]] 23:01, 3 March 2024 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia:Village pump (policy)#rfc_3F7FC70|Wikipedia:Village pump (policy)]] expired 2024-03-21 01:01 ===
* Id: 3F7FC70
* User: JoelleJay

Where articles on micronations use an infobox, should they use 

:A. infobox country (with the micronation parameter)

* RFC Text:
