=== [[Wikipedia talk:Citing sources#rfc_81A09EF|Wikipedia talk:Citing sources]] expired 2024-03-28 16:01 ===
* Id: 81A09EF
* User: Locke Cole
* Date: 2024-03-27 04:33:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_style_and_naming|prev|1215796064|STYLE 1215796064}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_technical_issues_and_templates|prev|1215796065|TECH 1215796065}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_style_and_naming|prev|1216025311|STYLE 1216025311}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_technical_issues_and_templates|prev|1216025312|TECH 1216025312}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
There appears to have been some misunderstandings above about what archiving a citation means (see [[WP:DEADREF]] for the current language and [[WP:ARCHIVEEARLY]] for the process, see [[WP:LINKROT]] for some reasons why archiving is a good idea). Just to reiterate, it '''does not''' mean replacing existing {{para|url}} with a link to Archive.org/Wayback Machine. It means filling the {{para|archive-url}} and {{para|archive-date}} parameters and setting {{para|url-status|live}} for links that are not presently dead (see {{tl|cite web}} for more details on the parameters and how they interact). While my reading was that creating such archive URLs was strongly encouraged, there appears to be a consensus that the current language ''does not even say that''. However, what I would propose is not explicitly '''requiring''' archive links, but perhaps language here that effectively disallows individual pages from banning the practice altogether. I can't really see where having them causes any harm to our editors or our readers, and the benefits of having them far outweigh the arguments against including them. 

All that being said, please indicate whether you '''Support''' including language that would forbid individual pages from creating a [[WP:LOCALCON]] to disallow archive links, or whether you would '''Oppose''' such language. ‚Äî[[User:Locke Cole|Locke Cole]] ‚Ä¢ [[User talk:Locke Cole|t]] ‚Ä¢ [[Special:Contributions/Locke Cole|c]] 04:33, 27 March 2024 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia talk:WikiProject Astronomy#rfc_3387719|Wikipedia talk:WikiProject Astronomy]] expired 2024-03-28 17:01 ===
* Id: 3387719
* User: CactiStaccingCrane
* Date: 2024-02-27 16:22:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|1210644065|SCI 1210644065}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|1216033950|SCI 1216033950}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
As a month passes by and [[Wikipedia_talk:WikiProject_Astronomy#Imperial/U.S._customary_units_in_the_infobox]] did not reach to a consensus, I think it is time to ask the wider community.

* '''Option 1''': Omit all of imperial/U.S. customary units in infobox, but allow using {{tl|cvt}} to convert numbers from the source to SI units
* '''Option 2''': Only use imperial/U.S. customary units in infobox if the source itself ''only'' use imperial/U.S. customary units
* '''Option 3''': Allow imperial/U.S. customary units in infobox
[[User:CactiStaccingCrane|CactiStaccingCrane]] ([[User talk:CactiStaccingCrane|talk]]) 16:22, 27 February 2024 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Interstate 90#rfc_D0DAFCB|Talk:Interstate 90]] expired 2024-03-30 23:01 ===
* Id: D0DAFCB
* User: RoadFan294857
* Date: 2024-02-29 23:00:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|1211115159|SCI 1211115159}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|1216426381|SCI 1216426381}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
After doing thorough research, I have found out that the WikiProject for Roads allows 10 significant junctions. Normally, this isn‚Äôt an issue but for a highway as long as I-90, there are a lot of junctions and there has been constant edit warring and talk page discussions over what junctions to include. I am proposing the following 

*'''Option A:''' Status quo
*'''Option B:''' Merging I-5 and SR-519 together, since they are right next to each other and we have done similar combination of junctions when they don‚Äôt exactly intersect in the same spot, see [[U.S. Route 20]] and the merger of I-87 and I-90, and how [[U.S. Route 11]] combines the junction of I-76 and I-81 despite not being in the exact same spot.
*'''Option C:''' Replace the second I-80 junction with another unique road, such as the I-87 junction in Albany, the I-29 junction in Sioux Falls, or even the concurrency with I-39. 
*'''Option D:''' Use IAR to allow 11 junctions.

Some of these options contradict each other, but feel free to support multiple options that don‚Äôt contradict or offer your own opinions. [[User:RoadFan294857|RoadFan294857]] ([[User talk:RoadFan294857|talk]]) 23:00, 29 February 2024 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia talk:Categories, lists, and navigation templates#rfc_F9D43D9|Wikipedia talk:Categories, lists, and navigation templates]] expired 2024-03-31 05:01 ===
* Id: F9D43D9
* User: Sdkb
* Date: 2024-03-01 04:56:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_style_and_naming|prev|1211165723|STYLE 1211165723}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|1211165725|POLICY 1211165725}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_style_and_naming|prev|1216466241|STYLE 1216466241}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|1216466244|POLICY 1216466244}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
What should [[WP:BIDIRECTIONAL]] say?
*'''Option A''' (status quo): {{tq|Every article that [[Help:Transclusion|transcludes]] a given navbox should normally also be included as a link in the navbox, so that the navigation is bidirectional.}}
*'''Option B''': {{tq|Articles that [[Help:Transclusion|transclude]] a given navbox should normally be included as a link in the navbox, enabling bidirectional navigation, but exceptions may be made when inclusion would be [[Wikipedia:Neutral point of view#Due and undue weight|undue]].}}
*'''Option C''': {{tq|There is no requirement that articles that [[Help:Transclusion|transclude]] a given navbox have to be included as a link in the navbox.}}
([[#Questioning_WP:BIDIRECTIONAL|Prior discussion]] above.) <span style="border:3px outset;border-radius:8pt 0;padding:1px 5px;background:linear-gradient(6rad,#86c,#2b9)">[[User:Sdkb|<span style="color:#FFF;text-decoration:inherit;font:1em Lucida Sans">Sdkb</span>]]</span>‚ÄØ<sup>[[User talk:Sdkb|'''talk''']]</sup> 04:56, 1 March 2024 (UTC)}}

** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Economy,_trade,_and_companies|prev|1216902148|ECON 1216902148}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
The question is whether or not to add the following section, named "Controversy", to the article:
{{talkquote|For a number of years there have been allegations that LiveJasmin, a brand of JWS Americas S.√† r.l., which is a subsidiary of "Duodecad IT Services" (part of "Docler Holding")<ref>{{Citation |title=LiveJasmin |date=2024-03-22 |work=Wikipedia |url=https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=LiveJasmin&oldid=1215043342 |access-date=2024-03-29 |language=en}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |title=Docler Holding - Gazdas√°gi sztorik √©rthet≈ëen |url=https://g7.hu/vallalat/20220104/az-atlathatatlan-gattyan-birodalomban-csak-a-felnott-tartalomban-sejlik-fel-a-penz/ |access-date=2024-03-29 |language=hu}}</ref>, is offering cam model work to models residing in countries where this job is illegal<ref>{{Citation |title=Pornography laws by region |date=2024-03-19 |work=Wikipedia |url=https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Pornography_laws_by_region&oldid=1214467495 |access-date=2024-03-27 |language=en}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web |last=Hungary |first=Attorney General |date=2015-09-16 |title=Case C-419/14 |url=https://eur-lex.europa.eu/legal-content/EN/TXT/PDF/?uri=ecli:ECLI%3AEU%3AC%3A2015%3A606 |access-date=2024-03-27 |website=eur-lex.europa.eu |language=en-EN}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web |last=Berger |first=Victor |date=2020-05-04 |title=Replika - {{talkquote|Recently, a Parliamentary Question regarding LiveJasmin<ref>{{Cite web |title=Activit√©s jug√©es dangereuses d'une holding luxembourgeoise exploitant une plateforme de streaming de webcams |url=https://www.chd.lu/fr/question/26367 |access-date=2024-03-22 |website=www.chd.lu |language=fr}}</ref>, titled "Parliamentary question relating to activities deemed dangerous by a Luxembourg holding company operating a pornographic webcam streaming platform."<ref>{{Cite web |last=Baum |first=Marc |date=25 January 2024 |title=Question parlementaire relative aux activit√©s jug√©es dangereuses d‚Äôune holding luxembourgeoise exploitant une plateforme de streaming de webcams pornographiques. |url=https://wdocs-pub.chd.lu/docs/exped/0144/130/289304.pdf |access-date=29 March 2024 |website=[[Chamber_of_Deputies_(Luxembourg)]]}}</ref>, was filed in the Parliament of Luxembourg, by MP Marc Baum<ref>{{Cite web |date=2024-03-27 |title=Marc Baum |url=https://www.wort.lu/politik/marc-baum/908683.html |access-date=2024-03-27 |website=luxemburger-wort-online |language=de}}</ref> of the "d√©i L√©nk"<ref>{{Citation |title=The Left (Luxembourg) |date=2024-03-06 |work=Wikipedia |url=https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=The_Left_(Luxembourg)&oldid=1212155440 |access-date=2024-03-29 |language=en}}</ref> party.}}{{br}}

{{talkquote|A Luxembourg based investigative journalism publication<ref>{{Cite web |date=2024-03-29 |title=REPORTER |url=https://www.reporter.lu/ |access-date=2024-03-29 |website=Reporter.lu |language=de-DE}}</ref> reported allegations, about LiveJasmin, that were similar to those made in the Parliamentary Question, in an article titled "Luxembourg porn company: Docler's delicate dealings in Uganda".<ref>{{Cite web |last=Caregari |first=Luc |date=2023-08-01 |title=Luxemburger Porno-Firma: Die heiklen Gesch√§fte von Docler in Uganda |url=https://www.reporter.lu/luxemburger-porno-firma-heiklen-geschaefte-von-docler-in-uganda/ |access-date=2024-03-22 |website=Reporter.lu |language=de-DE}}</ref> The article was authored by Luc Caregari<ref>{{Cite web |title=ICIJ member Luc Caregari |url=https://www.icij.org/journalists/luc-caregari/ |access-date=2024-03-22 |language=en-US}}</ref>, an investigative Journalist in Luxembourg.}}{{br}}
For more background, see discussion threads above as well as initial comments on my talk page [[User_talk:Alexfotios]].

=== [[Wikipedia talk:How many Wikipedians does it take to change a lightbulb?#rfc_65CD6EA|Wikipedia talk:How many Wikipedians does it take to change a lightbulb?]] expired 2024-04-02 17:01 ===
* Id: 65CD6EA
* User: MrPersonHumanGuy
* Date: 2024-04-01 10:19:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|1216674942|SCI 1216674942}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|1216674943|MEDIA 1216674943}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|1216674944|SOC 1216674944}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_proposals|prev|1216674947|PROP 1216674947}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|1216902155|SCI 1216902155}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|1216902157|MEDIA 1216902157}}

* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
As indicated by the speedy replacement notice at [[WP:LIGHTBULB]], that page's most recent lightbulb is burned out and needs to be replaced. What type of lightbulb should we replace it with?
* '''Option A''': [[Incandescent light|Incandescent]]
* '''Option B''': [[Compact fluorescent]]
* '''Option C''': [[LED]]
* '''Option D''': Other (please specify)
* '''Option E''': Keep current bulb
* '''Option F''': Disregard discussion and advise contributors to [[Outdoor recreation|touch grass]]
If you'd like, you may also go into specific details like wattage, brightness, [[color temperature]], manufacturer, and/or whether it can be [[dimmer|dimmed]], voice-activated, [[Internet of Things|computerized]], or come with other features.{{4-1}} ‚Äì [[User:MrPersonHumanGuy|MrPersonHumanGuy]] ([[User talk:MrPersonHumanGuy|talk]]) 10:19, 1 April 2024 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia:Reliable sources/Noticeboard#rfc_C685727|Wikipedia:Reliable sources/Noticeboard]] expired 2024-04-02 23:01 ===
* Id: C685727
* User: SarahJH07
* Date: 2024-03-15 04:51:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|1214097310|MEDIA 1214097310}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_proposals|prev|1214097317|PROP 1214097317}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|1218843464|MEDIA 1218843464}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_proposals|prev|1218843471|PROP 1218843471}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
What is the reliability of Allkpop for K-pop-related articles?
* '''Option 1: [[Wikipedia:GREL|Generally reliable]]'''
* '''Option 2: [[Wikipedia:MREL|Additional considerations]]'''
* '''Option 3: [[Wikipedia:GUNREL|Generally unreliable]]'''
* '''Option 4: [[Wikipedia:DEPREC|Deprecate]]'''

Allkpop is the English-language K-pop and celebrity gossip site and fan blog owned by 6Theory Media, which also owns Tokyohive. The site contains extensive Korean culture-related news coverage and rumours that are aimed at non-Korean audiences, this does not itself as a generally reliable source and also claims to be cited by major news organizations. They also made occasional interviews and special reports, which counts as first-hand journalism. It also licensed to stream [[Mnet Asian Music Awards|MAMA Awards]]. I consider the site itself was generally unreliable for K-pop articles.

{{linksummary|allkpop.com}} [[User:SarahJH07|sjh]] ([[User talk:SarahJH07|talk]]) 04:51, 15 March 2024 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Expungement#rfc_08278A3|Talk:Expungement]] expired 2024-04-04 12:01 ===
* Id: 08278A3
* User: Charlie Campbell 28
* Date: 2024-04-04 08:36:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|1217182775|POLICY 1217182775}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|1217199211|POLICY 1217199211}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
==RFC on Wikipedia policy on the reporting of expunged criminal records'''

Most US jurisdictions, including the state of Virginia where most Wikipedia servers are, permit the [[Expungement in the United States|expungement]] of certain criminal records. Most democratic countries have similar arrangements, for example the UK and Australia allow for many offences to become [[Spent conviction|'spent']]. The purpose of expungement, or 'spent' status, is to allow offenders a "second chance" (see article), particularly in respect of employment and other opportunities. The effect is to permit offenders to deny their expunged offences in many circumstances, and to constrain reporting on them without good reason (the fact of their existence is by definition not of itself sufficient reason). In the US, it is a misdemeanour in some states to report without good reason (acceptable reasons are laid out in relevant legislation); in the US and UK it is a tort to report without good reason. Should Wikipedia permit the reporting of expunged/spent convictions in our articles, and if so what criteria for such inclusion should apply?[[User:Charlie Campbell 28|Charlie Campbell 28]] ([[User talk:Charlie Campbell 28|talk]]) 08:36, 4 April 2024 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia:Village pump (proposals)#rfc_7AC8539|Wikipedia:Village pump (proposals)]] expired 2024-04-07 02:01 ===
* Id: 7AC8539
* User: Cocobb8
* Date: 2024-03-16 15:19:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_proposals|prev|1214035680|PROP 1214035680}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_proposals|prev|1219074451|PROP 1219074451}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
I am proposing that <code><nowiki>tp:</nowiki></code> be added as an alias to the <code><nowiki>Template:</nowiki></code> namespace per [[Wikipedia:Village_pump_(technical)#New_alias_for_template_namespace|this discussion]].

Note: Though previous aliases were already [[Wikipedia:Perennial_proposals#Create_shortcut_namespace_aliases_for_various_namespaces|listed on perennial proposals]], it proposed <code><nowiki>t:</nowiki></code>, which would have conflicted with some article titles, or be confused with the <code><nowiki>Talk:</nowiki></code> namespace. <code><nowiki>Tp:</nowiki></code>, on the other hand, wouldn't, and would make it way quicker to look up a template in the search bar.


<u>Edit (during rfc): <code><nowiki>tp:</nowiki></code> was not fully supported due to it being confused with "Talk Page", however other options were proposed, like hard coding <code><nowiki>{{</nowiki></code> being replaced by <code><nowiki>Template:</nowiki></code> in the search bar, or other aliases like <code><nowiki>tmp:</nowiki></code>.</u> [[User:Cocobb8|'''<span style="color:purple">Coco</span><span style="color:green">bb8</span>''']] (üí¨ [[User talk:Cocobb8|talk]] ‚Ä¢ ‚úèÔ∏è [[Special:Contributions/Cocobb8|contribs]]) 15:19, 16 March 2024 (UTC)}}


=== [[Talk:Republican Party (United States)#rfc_3425AD3|Talk:Republican Party (United States)]] expired 2024-04-07 14:01 ===
* Id: 3425AD3
* User: Firefangledfeathers
* Date: 2024-03-08 13:40:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1212438041|POL 1212438041}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1217724701|POL 1217724701}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Should the article mention support for the Great Replacement conspiracy theory among the GOP?
*'''A''': Mentioning of support for the Great Replacement conspiracy theory among the GOP '''should''' be included in the article.
*'''B''': Mentioning of support for the Great Replacement conspiracy theory among the GOP '''should not''' be included in the article.
[[User:Firefangledfeathers|Firefangledfeathers]] ([[User talk:Firefangledfeathers|talk]] / [[Special:Contributions/Firefangledfeathers|contribs]]) 13:40, 8 March 2024 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Robert F. Kennedy Jr.#rfc_DF05D32|Talk:Robert F. Kennedy Jr.]] expired 2024-04-08 10:01 ===
* Id: DF05D32
* User: KlayCax
* Date: 2024-04-06 02:07:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1217494354|POL 1217494354}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|1217494356|SOC 1217494356}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1217866506|POL 1217866506}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|1217866512|SOC 1217866512}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
What should the first sentence say about Kennedy Jr.?
# is an American politician, environmental lawyer, activist, and conspiracy theorist (and/or) anti-vaccine activist. (With Kennedy assassination + anti-vaccine misinformation + public health conspiracy conspiracy theories moved to another part of the lead.) 
# is an American politician, environmental lawyer, and activist who promotes conspiracy theories surrounding members of the Kennedy family, anti-vaccine misinformation, and other public health conspiracy theories. ({{tqi|conspiracy theories surrounding members of the Kennedy family, anti-vaccine misinformation, and other public health conspiracy theories}} should be stated twice. Once in the leading sentence. The other in the last paragraph of the lead.)
# is an American politician, environmental lawyer, and activist who promotes anti-vaccine misinformation and public health conspiracy theories. ({{tqi|"Who promotes anti-vaccine misinformation and public health conspiracy theories".}} should be stated twice. One time in the first sentence. The other in the last paragraph of the lead.)
# Conspiracy theories about the Kennedy assassinations, anti-vaccine misinformation, and public health conspiracy theories shouldn't be mentioned in the lead at all. 
# Another option not listed. 

Started due to long-term editing dispute without consensus. Interested to see everyone's thoughts. Thanks! :) [[User:KlayCax|KlayCax]] ([[User talk:KlayCax|talk]]) 02:07, 6 April 2024 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:2024 United States presidential election#rfc_1E07278|Talk:2024 United States presidential election]] expired 2024-04-13 07:01 ===
* Id: 1E07278
* User: KlayCax
* Date: 2024-03-14 06:36:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Economy,_trade,_and_companies|prev|1213637788|ECON 1213637788}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1213637793|POL 1213637793}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|1213637798|SOC 1213637798}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Economy,_trade,_and_companies|prev|1218694410|ECON 1218694410}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1218694412|POL 1218694412}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|1218694418|SOC 1218694418}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
There has been a longstanding debate on this page about when candidates should be added into the infobox.
# Wait until the major party conventions nominate their chosen candidates.
# Wait until we see which candidates will ultimately qualify for the infobox, per the decided upon criteria of the above RFC.
# Include major party candidates now; decision for third-party candidates should be decided upon criteria of the above RFC.

The results of this RFC should not be interpreted as [[WP: PRECEDENT]] outside of this article. [[User:KlayCax|KlayCax]] ([[User talk:KlayCax|talk]]) 06:36, 14 March 2024 (UTC)}}


=== [[Talk:2024 United States presidential election#rfc_7F9D070|Talk:2024 United States presidential election]] expired 2024-04-13 07:01 ===
* Id: 7F9D070
* User: KlayCax
* Date: 2024-03-14 06:12:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Economy,_trade,_and_companies|prev|1214773671|ECON 1214773671}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1214773673|POL 1214773673}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|1214773674|SOC 1214773674}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Economy,_trade,_and_companies|prev|1218694410|ECON 1218694410}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1218694412|POL 1218694412}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|1218694418|SOC 1218694418}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
There has been a longstanding debate on this page about the criteria required for a candidate to be eligible for the infobox.
* '''Criterion #1a:''' A candidate who ''generally'' polls at 5% or above in major polling aggregators. ([[RealClearPolitics]], [[FiveThirtyEight]], ''et al.'')
* '''Criterion #1b:''' A candidate who ''generally'' polls at 10% or above in major polling aggregators. ([[RealClearPolitics]], [[FiveThirtyEight]], ''et al.'')
* '''Criterion #1c:''' A candidate who ''generally'' polls at 15% or above in major polling aggregators. ([[RealClearPolitics]], [[FiveThirtyEight]], ''et al.'')
* '''Criterion #2a:''' Media coverage that considers them to have a ''significant'' chance (>5-10% or above) to win the national election.
* '''Criterion #2b:''' Media coverage that considers them a major candidate in the race, regardless of whether they have a significant chance of winning.
* '''Criterion #3:''' Reaching and participating in a presidential debate hosted by the [[Commission on Presidential Debates]].
* '''Criterion #4:''' Nomination from a major party ''only''. Third-party candidates shouldn't be listed.
* '''Criterion #5:''' If the candidate holds political beliefs that are non-fringe, mainstream, and polls above a certain percentage. (Whether 1%, 5%, 10%, and 15%.)
* '''Criterion #6:''' Having [[ballot access]] in states that comprise 270 [[Electoral college|electoral votes]] ''and'' meets criteria #1a, #1b, or #1c.
* '''Criterion #7:''' Another criterion not listed or a requirement that they fulfill multiple criteria of the above. (Explain how and why.)

The results of this RFC should not be interpreted as [[WP: PRECEDENT]] outside of this article. [[User:KlayCax|KlayCax]] ([[User talk:KlayCax|talk]]) 06:12, 14 March 2024 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:2024 United States presidential election#rfc_376CBEA|Talk:2024 United States presidential election]] expired 2024-04-13 08:01 ===
* Id: 376CBEA
* User: KlayCax
* Date: 2024-04-06 02:15:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|1217494347|HIST 1217494347}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|1217494352|MEDIA 1217494352}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1217494354|POL 1217494354}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|1217494356|SOC 1217494356}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|1222462916|HIST 1222462916}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|1222462918|MEDIA 1222462918}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1222462921|POL 1222462921}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|1222462923|SOC 1222462923}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
There is currently an edit dispute on whether Kennedy Jr. should appear in the infobox of states that will ''likely'' not receive polling in the 2024 presidential election ''or have not been polled yet''. 

'''Option #1:''' Kennedy Jr. should appear in the infobox of ''every'' state he has ballot access in. 

'''Option #2:''' If the aggregate state polling shows Kennedy Jr. under >5% or >10% (whatever is determined by the RFC): then he shouldn't be included. If no polling has been done ''or'' he is above 5-10%, then he should be included.

'''Option #3:''' Kennedy Jr. should not appear in the infobox if polling of the state has not been performed.

Thanks! :) [[User:KlayCax|KlayCax]] ([[User talk:KlayCax|talk]]) 02:15, 6 April 2024 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Israel‚ÄìHamas war#rfc_2D3F0FE|Talk:Israel‚ÄìHamas war]] expired 2024-04-13 22:01 ===
* Id: 2D3F0FE
* Date: 2024-04-13 08:49:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1218704375|POL 1218704375}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1218795737|POL 1218795737}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
'''Question 1'''. How should we describe the proportion of civilian casualties
* '''A''': state that there are no reliable figures, per [https://www.bbc.com/news/world-middle-east-67764664] (with or without in-text attribution)
* '''B''': give several estimates or a range (e.g., "10% according to X, 90% according to Y", or "10-90% according to various estimates")
(Options A and B can be combined)
* '''C''': other (don't include at all or anything else that's not covered by A and B)

'''Question 2'''. If we were to provide estimates (Option B of Q1), then which sources should be taken into account (I've listed the ones that were brought up in the discussion here so far and had explicit percentages or ratios)
* '''A''': "Prof Michael Spagat, said he would "not be at all surprised" if around 80% of those killed were civilians" [https://www.bbc.com/news/world-middle-east-67764664] (December 2023)
* '''C''': 60% (1:1.5 ratio) according to [[John Spencer (military officer)|John Spencer]] [https://www.newsweek.com/israel-has-created-new-standard-urban-warfare-why-will-no-one-admit-it-opinion-1883286] (March 2024)
* '''B''': 61%, according to the [[IDF]] [https://www.theguardian.com/world/2023/dec/09/civilian-toll-israeli-airstrikes-gaza-unprecedented-killing-study] (December 2023)
* '''D''': 66% (1:2 ratio), according to [[Andrew Roberts, Baron Roberts of Belgravia|Andrew Roberts]] [https://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/2024/02/19/hamas-israel-idf-gaza-casualty-figures-moral-holocaust/] (February 2024)
* '''E''': Other estimates.
[[User:Alaexis|Alaexis]]<sub>[[User_talk:Alaexis|¬øquestion?]]</sub> 08:49, 13 April 2024 (UTC)}}

‚Äî&nbsp;'''''[[User:Newslinger|<span style="color:#536267;">Newslinger</span>]]'''&nbsp;<small>[[User talk:Newslinger#top|<span style="color:#708090;">talk</span>]]</small>'' 21:46, 16 March 2024 (UTC)}}


=== [[Talk:Timelash#rfc_1C576FC|Talk:Timelash]] expired 2024-04-14 13:01 ===
* Id: 1C576FC
* User: OlifanofmrTennant
* Date: 2024-04-14 03:44:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|1218836583|MEDIA 1218836583}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|1218887408|MEDIA 1218887408}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
So I was looking over a few articles and noticed that Timelash is labeled a serial despite only being two parts, as are other two parters in classic who. eg. [[The Edge of Destruction]], [[The Ultimate Foe]], and most other season 22 stories. 
However, with New who two part stories are all labeled as two part stories and not serials, eg. [[Spyfall (Doctor Who)|Spyfall]], [[The End of Time (Doctor Who)|The End of Time]], [[World Enough and Time (Doctor Who)|World Enough and Time]]&[[The Doctor Falls]]. Now the answer you might be inclined to give is New Who gives each episode a different name which is not always true Spyfall/End of Time, or that Classic Who labels them all parts and not names once again not always true Edge of Destruction.
<br/>
So is there any meaningfull difference between Timelash and Spyfall to make a distinction or is just an arbitrary or stylistic choice. <b>[[User talk:OlifanofmrTennant|Questions?]] [[Fourth Doctor|four]] [[User:OlifanofmrTennant|Olifanofmrtennant (she/her)]]</b> 03:44, 14 April 2024 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Sri Lanka Armed Forces#rfc_391BB84|Talk:Sri Lanka Armed Forces]] expired 2024-04-18 00:01 ===
* Id: 391BB84
* User: Robert McClenon
* Date: 2024-03-18 23:06:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|1214440394|HIST 1214440394}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1214440399|POL 1214440399}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|1214440405|SOC 1214440405}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|1219472826|HIST 1219472826}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1219472829|POL 1219472829}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|1219472838|SOC 1219472838}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
The first sentence of the section on alleged war crimes in the Sri Lankan Civil War currently reads:
{{tqb|The Armed Forces along with the LTTE have been accused of committing war crimes during the war, particularly during the final stages. A panel of experts appointed by UN Secretary-General Ban Ki-moon to advise him on the issue of accountability with regard to any alleged violations of international human rights and humanitarian law during the final stages of the civil war found "credible allegations" which, if proven, indicated that war crimes and crimes against humanity were committed by the Sri Lankan Armed Forces and the LTTE, with most civilian casualties in the final phases of the war being blamed on Sri Lankan Army shelling, with the LTTE preventing the civilian from leaving as they used them as human shields and attempted to create an humanitarian crises.}}
Should the last phrase read:
:'''A''' {{tq|with most civilian casualties in the final phases of the war being blamed on indiscriminate Sri Lankan Army shelling and the LTTE being blamed for using civilians as a human buffer.}}
:OR
:'''B''' {{tq|with the LTTE accused of significantly adding to the death toll in the final stages of the war, by using civilians as a human buffer and shooting civilians attempting to escape the conflict zone.}}
?  
[[User:Robert McClenon|Robert McClenon]] ([[User talk:Robert McClenon|talk]]) 23:06, 18 March 2024 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:1977 anti-Tamil pogrom#rfc_D09A041|Talk:1977 anti-Tamil pogrom]] expired 2024-04-18 01:01 ===
* Id: D09A041
* User: Oz346
* Date: 2024-03-19 00:54:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|1214456705|HIST 1214456705}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1214456707|POL 1214456707}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|1214456710|SOC 1214456710}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|1219472826|HIST 1219472826}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1219481557|POL 1219481557}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|1219481559|SOC 1219481559}}
* RFC Text:

The last paragraph on the [[1977_anti-Tamil_pogrom#Presidential_Commission_of_Inquiry|Presidential Commission of Inquiry]] currently reads:

{{tqb|Following his inquiry, Justice Sansoni submitted his report, which was known as the "Sansoni Report" to President Jayewardene in July 1980.<ref name="presidential commission" /> The riots were explained in the Sansoni Report in terms of "Sinhalese reaction to Tamil separatist demands, terrorist acts committed in the name of separatism, and anti-Sinhalese statements allegedly made by Tamil politicians in the course of the 1977 general election campaign".<ref name="Kearney">{{cite journal |last1=Kearney |first1=Robert N. |date=March 1986 |title=Tension and Conflict in Sri Lanka |url=https://www.jstor.org/stable/45315688 |journal=Current History |volume=85 |issue=509 |pages=110}}</ref> The Sansoni Report has been criticized for pro-government bias,<ref>{{Cite book |last=Hoole |first=Rajan |url=https://www.uthr.org/Book/CHA02.htm#_Toc527947390 |title=Sri Lanka: The Arrogance of Power : Myths, Decadence & Murder |publisher=University Teachers for Human Rights (Jaffna) |year=2001 |chapter=Chapter 2: Antecedents of July 1983 and the Foundations of Impunity}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web |last=Sabaratnam |first=T. |date=23 November 2003 |title=Pirapaharan: Vol.1, Chap. 18 Tamils Lose Faith in Commissions |url=https://sangam.org/pirapaharan-vol-1-chap-18-tamils-lose-faith-in-commissions/ |website=Ilankai Tamil Sangam}}</ref><ref>{{Cite book |last=Sivanayagam |first=S. |title=Sri Lanka: Witness to History - A Journalist's Memoirs, 1930-2004 |date=2005 |publisher=Sivayogam |isbn=978-0-9549647-0-2 |location=London |page=283}}</ref><ref>{{Cite book |last=Manoharan |first=N. |title=Democratic Dilemma: Ethnic Violence and Human Rights in Sri Lanka |date=2008 |publisher=Samskriti |isbn=9788187374503 |location=New Delhi |page=90}}</ref> being hampered by political interference<ref>Amnesty International, June 11, 2009 Index Number: ASA 37/005/2009
Sri Lanka: Twenty years of make-believe. Sri Lanka‚Äôs Commissions of Inquiry, p.9, https://www.amnesty.org/en/wp-content/uploads/2021/06/asa370052009eng.pdf</ref><ref>Kishali Pinto Jayawardena, Sunday Times, Feb 17th 2008,  Focus on Rights, Further reflections on commission inquiries and rights violations - Part Three, https://www.sundaytimes.lk/080217/Columns/focus.html</ref><ref>Kishali Pinto Jayawardena, Sunday Times, Oct 28th 2007, Discussing mock turtles and commissions of inquiry, https://www.sundaytimes.lk/080217/Columns/focus.html</ref> and for "[[victim blaming]]" Tamils.<ref>{{Citation |last=de Silva |first=Premakumara |title=Ethnicity and Violence in Sri Lanka: An Ethnohistorical Narrative |date=2019 |work=The Palgrave Handbook of Ethnicity |page=16 |editor-last=Ratuva |editor-first=Steven |url=https://link.springer.com/referenceworkentry/10.1007/978-981-13-0242-8_47-1 |access-date=2024-03-12 |place=Singapore |publisher=Springer |language=en |last2=Haniffa |first2=Farzana |last3=Bastin |first3=Rohan}}</ref>}}

One editor wants the last paragraph to be changed to the following, as he believes both the Kearney and Manogaran sources have "accepted" the reasons attributed by Sansoni for the riots, whereas other editors believe that those sources are merely summarising Sansoni's reasons, and are not personal approvals. Do you agree with the proposed change below?

{{tqb|Following his inquiry, Justice Sansoni submitted his report, which was known as the "Sansoni Report" to President Jayewardene in July 1980.<ref name="presidential commission" /> 

Over the years the Sansoni Report has been recived diffrent reviews. Robert N. Kearney found that the Sansoni Report explained the riots in terms of "Sinhalese reaction to Tamil separatist demands, terrorist acts committed in the name of separatism, and anti-Sinhalese statements allegedly made by Tamil politicians in the course of the 1977 general election campaign".<ref name="Kearney">{{cite journal |last1=Kearney |first1=Robert N. |date=March 1986 |title=Tension and Conflict in Sri Lanka |url=https://www.jstor.org/stable/45315688 |journal=Current History |volume=85 |issue=509 |pages=110}}</ref> According to Chelvadurai Manogaran, the Sansoni Report attributed many factors as the cause of the riots, including "TULFs anti-Sinhalese proganda advocating separatism, Sinhalese extremists' statements claiming that Tamils intended to wipe out the Sinhalese and acts of violence committed by the liberation Tigers". The immediate cause of the violence Manogaran finds is rumor of Sinhalese policemen been attacked in Jaffna by Tamil militants. He further states that due to the violance (in Augest 1977) and events that followed many Tamils both extreme and moderate were convinced the need to establish a separate state<ref name="Chelvadurai">{{cite book |last1=Manogaran |first1=Chelvadurai |title=Ethnic Conflict and Reconciliation in Sri Lanka |date=1987 |publisher=University of Hawaii Press |location=Honolulu |pages=63-65 |url=https://scholarspace.manoa.hawaii.edu/server/api/core/bitstreams/4f3811e7-1962-495d-bad0-12f31e6754d9/content |access-date=12 March 2024}}</ref>

The Sansoni Report has been criticized for pro-government bias by [[Rajan Hoole]] of the [[University Teachers for Human Rights]]<ref>{{Cite book |last=Hoole |first=Rajan |url=https://www.uthr.org/Book/CHA02.htm#_Toc527947390 |title=Sri Lanka: The Arrogance of Power : Myths, Decadence & Murder |publisher=University Teachers for Human Rights (Jaffna) |year=2001 |chapter=Chapter 2: Antecedents of July 1983 and the Foundations of Impunity}}</ref> and T. Sabaratnam in his biography of [[Velupillai Prabhakaran]].<ref>{{Cite web |last=Sabaratnam |first=T. |date=23 November 2003 |title=Pirapaharan: Vol.1, Chap. 18 Tamils Lose Faith in Commissions |url=https://sangam.org/pirapaharan-vol-1-chap-18-tamils-lose-faith-in-commissions/ |website=Ilankai Tamil Sangam}}</ref>}}
[[User:Oz346|Oz346]] ([[User talk:Oz346|talk]]) 00:54, 19 March 2024 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Elliot Rodger#rfc_991E86E|Talk:Elliot Rodger]] expired 2024-04-18 17:01 ===
* Id: 991E86E
* User: Shoot for the Stars
* Date: 2024-04-17 23:09:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|1219472822|BIO 1219472822}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|1219587013|BIO 1219587013}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
[[user:Black Kite|Black Kite]] stated there needed to be a discussion before this article can get created. I made this article because Elliot Rodger is the one who shot the incel community into the mainstream and has made people inspired to do attacks like his almost ten years later. [https://www.bbc.com/news/world-us-canada-43892189] [https://www.vice.com/en/article/bvnw3d/incels-elliot-rodger-misogyny-far-right] [https://www.the-independent.com/news/world/americas/crime/david-kaufman-elliot-rodger-incel-stalker-b2058474.html] [https://www.newstatesman.com/comment/2023/10/incel-ideology-entered-mainstream] There are multiple articles talking about his mental health [https://psychcentral.com/blog/the-psychology-of-elliot-rodger#1] [https://www.psychologytoday.com/us/blog/keeping-kids-safe/201405/elliot-rodger-psychotic-psychopath] [https://slate.com/technology/2014/05/elliot-rodger-therapists-why-did-they-and-law-enforcement-fail-to-recognize-his-threat.html] [https://theconversation.com/aspergers-is-an-unlikely-cause-for-california-killers-violence-27194] and Rodger's rampage also inspired and made women talk about sexism and misogyny and stared the hashtag #YesAllWomen. [https://www.theguardian.com/commentisfree/2014/may/28/yesallwomen-barage-sexism-elliot-rodger] [https://www.washingtonpost.com/local/yesallwomen-elliott-rodgers-misogynistic-ravings-inspire-a-powerful-response-on-twitter/2014/05/26/dd755e4e-e4e0-11e3-8f90-73e071f3d637_story.html] [https://www.newyorker.com/culture/culture-desk/the-power-of-yesallwomen] [https://time.com/116388/yesallwomen-hashtag/]. He also caused the hashtag #NotAllMen, where men said they didn't have the same viewpoints like Rodger and wouldn't murder women because of it. [https://www.huffingtonpost.co.uk/jessie-thompson/elliot-rodger-not-all-men_b_5394396.html] [https://www.dallasnews.com/opinion/commentary/2014/05/28/powerful-twitter-response-to-elliot-rodgers-misogynistic-bile/] [http://america.aljazeera.com/opinions/2014/5/elliot-rodger-culturalmisogynymurderwomen.html] [https://www.delawareonline.com/story/opinion/contributors/2014/05/29/killers-sex-mad-ravings-reveal-warped-male-culture/9736055/]. They also looked into his online life and how he was racist, hated women and talked bad about them, and was already looking to murder these poor college students [https://www.theguardian.com/world/2014/may/30/elliot-rodger-puahate-forever-alone-reddit-forums] [https://www.businessinsider.com/ucsb-shooting-forum-associated-with-elliot-rodger-reacts-2014-5][https://www.newyorker.com/tech/annals-of-technology/the-online-life-of-elliot-rodger]. His rampage also brought forward more calls for gun control and inspired multiple laws that are now enacted [https://www.cbsnews.com/news/gun-law-proposed-in-california-in-wake-of-elliot-rodgers-killing-spree/] [https://www.dailybulletin.com/2014/05/28/elliot-rodger-a-product-of-our-failed-society-letters/][https://www.nytimes.com/2014/05/29/us/in-wake-of-mass-shooting-a-gun-bill-is-pushed-in-california.html] [https://www.independent.com/2014/09/02/elliot-rodger-bills-pass-legislature/]. Also talked about how mental health sources needed to be updated as well [https://www.theguardian.com/world/2014/may/25/sheriff-mental-health-shortcomings-california-rampage] [https://www.nbcnews.com/storyline/isla-vista-rampage/should-cops-rummage-through-social-media-accounts-assess-mental-stability-n119026] [https://www.npr.org/2014/05/29/317025705/should-elliot-rodgers-bigotry-have-raised-alarm-bells]. [[User:Shoot for the Stars|Shoot for the Stars]] ([[User talk:Shoot for the Stars|talk]]) 23:09, 17 April 2024 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia:Village pump (policy)#rfc_047545E|Wikipedia:Village pump (policy)]] expired 2024-04-22 05:01 ===
* Id: 047545E
* User: Clovermoss
* Date: 2024-04-10 11:33:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_proposals|prev|1218210910|PROP 1218210910}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_proposals|prev|1223180286|PROP 1223180286}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Currently, the status quo for events listed on the main page is to use the present tense, even if the event in question has definitively ended. I didn't really notice this was an issue until yesterday when I noticed that the main page said that the [[Solar eclipse of April 8, 2024]] is visible through parts of North America. Knowing that it was '''not''' currently visible and double checking that the article referred to the event in the past tense, I changed this to '''was''' visible. [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template:In_the_news&diff=prev&oldid=1218143475] I did not realize that this is against the current consensus at [[WP:ITNBLURB]] which says that these events must always be described in the present tense. If one is interested in further background, I encourage them to read this discussion [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Wikipedia:Main_Page/Errors&oldid=1218192091 here] (scroll down to errors).

I think that this status quo is misleading to readers because it cases like this, we are deliberately giving inaccurate and outdated information. I believe this is a disservice to our readers. The eclipse is ''not'' visible anymore, yet we must insist that it is indeed visible. I think that we should also be consistent... If the article for a blurb is using the past tense, we should use the past tense on the main page. Therefore, '''I propose that events listed on ITN that have definitively ended should be described in the past tense if it would otherwise mislead readers into thinking an event is ongoing.''' [[User:Clovermoss|<span style="color:darkorchid">Clovermoss</span><span style="color:green">üçÄ</span>]] [[User talk:Clovermoss|(talk)]] 11:33, 10 April 2024 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Space marine#rfc_9E3E487|Talk:Space marine]] expired 2024-04-22 18:01 ===
* Id: 9E3E487
* User: Di (they-them)
* Date: 2024-03-23 17:15:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|1215193101|MEDIA 1215193101}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|1220255292|MEDIA 1220255292}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
This page has a fairly large section that takes up about half of the page detailing a list of times that space marines have appeared in fiction. I removed the section on the basis of it being unsourced, [[WP:FANCRUFT]], and for it being an [[WP:INDISCRIMINATE]] list of [[WP:TRIVIA]]. However, this edit was reverted because an editor thought that this section was "very different" from other pop-culture sections. Instead of engaging in an edit war, I would like to make a request for comments to decide if the section should be removed, stay, or if some other solution can be decided on. Thanks. [[User:Di (they-them)|Di (they-them)]] ([[User talk:Di (they-them)|talk]]) 17:15, 23 March 2024 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:J. K. Rowling#rfc_6F624B2|Talk:J. K. Rowling]] expired 2024-04-24 01:01 ===
* Id: 6F624B2
* User: 13tez
* Date: 2024-04-04 23:30:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|1217294306|BIO 1217294306}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|1217294318|POLICY 1217294318}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1217647753|POL 1217647753}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|1220477555|BIO 1220477555}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1220477560|POL 1220477560}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|1220477564|POLICY 1220477564}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Should we add Rowling's [https://www.independent.co.uk/arts-entertainment/books/news/jk-rowling-india-willoughby-twitter-gender-b2507309.html comments on India Willoughby] from March 2024 to the end of the second paragraph of [[J._K._Rowling#Transgender_people|views -> transgender people]] before the paragraph as a whole is rewritten? I am proposing that we (only) add a short summary of the fact she did misgender Willoughby on Twitter and a short quote of one of the comments she made (see examples I have proposed elsewhere in this talk page). It would have a maximum length of two sentences. Subsequent developments after her comments themselves (police report etc) would not be included. The comments Rowling made on Willoughby in March are separate from those made on several transgender people including Willoughby on April Fools' Day. I'm almost certain her comments in March were the first times Rowling publicly misgendered a trans person. This would not include Rowling's additional recent comments on trans people in Nazi Germany, or other recent (separate) topics related to her views on trans people. [[User:13tez|13tez]] ([[User talk:13tez|talk]]) 23:30, 4 April 2024 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Bokator#rfc_0CBC52A|Talk:Bokator]] expired 2024-04-24 15:01 ===
* Id: 0CBC52A
* User: Pierrevang3
* Date: 2024-03-25 14:09:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|1215503983|SOC 1215503983}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|1220556193|SOC 1220556193}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Should the Bokator article mention "The martial art is believed to be the precursor of all forms of kickboxing present in the former provinces of the Khmer empire, namely Kun Khmer in Cambodia, Muay Lao in Laos and Muay Thai in Thailand"? The discussion in the talk page with [[User:Gandtha|Gandtha]] seems to be going nowhere and the aggressivity([https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=User_talk%3APierrevang3&diff=1215428921&oldid=1214666133]) is increasing, while the reverts keep on going. Previous consensus on the matter has been reached on the talk page of Muay Thai[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Talk:Muay_Thai], it was decided not to include contentious journalistic sources but only academic sources. For context regarding the reference (book) cited in the talk page, Bokator led to Muay Korat which led to Muay Boran which itself led to Muay Thai. [[User:Pierrevang3|Pierrevang3]] ([[User talk:Pierrevang3|talk]]) 14:09, 25 March 2024 (UTC)}}

* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
As this talk page shows, there has been an intractable debate on whether the subject should be described as Greek (or Albanian etc) and what spelling his name should have and connected questions. This RfC hopes to solve this issue. The issues are as follows:
* '''How should the subject of the article be named? '''
:* Is the Albanian-language version of his name necessary or appropriate?
:* What prominence should be given to the Albanian-language version of his name?
* '''Is it appropriate to describe him in the lead as Greek?'''
[[User:Jtrrs0|Jtrrs0]] ([[User talk:Jtrrs0|talk]]) 12:23, 1 April 2024 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Barkley Marathons#rfc_67E48AB|Talk:Barkley Marathons]] expired 2024-04-26 04:01 ===
* Id: 67E48AB
* User: PyropePe
* Date: 2024-03-27 03:29:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|1215791004|SOC 1215791004}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|1225753974|SOC 1225753974}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Should Female finishers be recorded separately for the Barkley Marathons?

A number of related questions have come up on this article in the past few days due to Jasmin Paris recently becoming the first woman to complete the Barkley Marathons. Most sporting events keep stats separately based on gender but the Barkley Marathons don't make this distinction as they aren't part of any kind of larger organization or used as qualifiers for anything. 

It's important to note that the table originally came from a discussion on labeling her time as the "slowest finish", a metric often recorded for fixed time races but could be seen as demeaning the first woman to finish the race to outsiders. Input on that subject is also appreciated. [[User:PyropePe|PyropePe]] ([[User talk:PyropePe|talk]]) 03:29, 27 March 2024 (UTC)}}

** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1222021568|POL 1222021568}}

* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
<nowiki>Wikipedia articles about religious organizations often contain a ‚Äúbeliefs‚Äù section that describes the beliefs and practices of the organization and its members. Is About Self sourcing on the organization‚Äôs beliefs or practices acceptable as Reliable Sourcing when the information is derived directly from the religious organization or published by an employee or member of the organization irrespective of whether secondary sourcing is available? This RfC assumes that all other Wikipedia editing policies are observed. ~~~~ </nowiki> [[User:Meta Voyager|Meta Voyager]] ([[User talk:Meta Voyager|talk]]) 17:26, 15 April 2024 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Barkley Marathons#rfc_FA10BFF|Talk:Barkley Marathons]] expired 2024-04-26 17:01 ===
* Id: FA10BFF
* Revisions affecting this RFC:

{{talkquote|There have been allegations that LiveJasmin, a brand of JWS Americas S.√† r.l., which is a subsidiary of "Duodecad IT Services" (part of "Docler Holding")<ref>{{cite web |title=Docler Holding - About Us - Companies / Products - DuoDecad IT Services S.√† r.l. |url=https://www.doclerholding.com/en/about/companies/39/ |access-date=15 May 2020 |archive-date=22 October 2021 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20211022014530/https://www.doclerholding.com/en/about/companies/39/ |url-status=dead }}</ref><ref>{{Cite web |title=Gy√∂rgy Gatty√°n reprend le contr√¥le de Docler |url=https://paperjam.lu/article/gyorgy-gattyan-reprend-control |access-date=2024-04-05 |website=paperjam.lu |language=fr}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web |title=WIPO Domain Name Decision: D2019-1712 |url=https://www.wipo.int/amc/en/domains/decisions/text/2019/d2019-1712.html |access-date=2024-04-05 |website=www.wipo.int}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web |date=2022-01-04 |title=Az √°tl√°thatatlan Gatty√°n-birodalomban csak a feln≈ëtt tartalomban sejlik fel a p√©nz {{!}} G7 - Gazdas√°gi sztorik √©rthet≈ëen |url=https://g7.hu/vallalat/20220104/az-atlathatatlan-gattyan-birodalomban-csak-a-felnott-tartalomban-sejlik-fel-a-penz/ |access-date=2024-03-29 |language=hu}}</ref>, is offering cam model work to models in countries where this job is illegal<ref name="Replika">{{Cite journal |last=Barna |first=Em√≠lia |date=2020 |title=A magyarorsz√°gi szexkamera-ipar√°g (The Hungarian sex camera industry) |url=https://replika.hu/en/system/files/archivum/replika_117-118-05_barna_-_katona.pdf |journal=Replika |issue=117-118 |pages=101,108 |via=[[National_Sz√©ch√©nyi_Library]]}}</ref>, like the [[Philippines]]<ref>{{Cite web |last=thephuketnews.com |first=thephuketnews.com |date=13 May 2011 |title=Former Phuket resident gets life in jail |url=https://www.thephuketnews.com/former-phuket-resident-gets-life-in-jail-25009.php |access-date=2 April 2024 |website=[[The_Phuket_News]]}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web |last=Deveza |first=J. === [[Talk:Reconquista#rfc_68AA61B|Talk:Reconquista]] expired 2024-04-28 21:01 ===
* Id: 68AA61B
* User: ÿ•ŸäÿßŸÜ
* Date: 2024-03-29 20:11:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|1216230939|HIST 1216230939}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|1221259068|HIST 1221259068}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
With regard to [[WP:Verifiability]], [[WP:NPOV]], and current academic consensus, should the article present the Reconquista as a matter of historical fact at face value or as historiographical narrative? 

This has been a perennial discussion (such as [[Talk:Reconquista/Archive 3#Lead|here]]), and the article would benefit from some stabilizing, somewhat binding consensus. I am hoping for robust engagement with the latest scholarship and the most reliable sources. [[User:ÿ•ŸäÿßŸÜ|ÿ•ŸäÿßŸÜ]] ([[User talk:ÿ•ŸäÿßŸÜ|talk]]) 20:11, 29 March 2024 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Elissa Slotkin#rfc_E4B4EF4|Talk:Elissa Slotkin]] expired 2024-04-29 03:01 ===
* Id: E4B4EF4
* User: OrcaLord
* Date: 2024-03-30 02:25:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1216272441|POL 1216272441}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1221302167|POL 1221302167}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
 There has been a lot of discussions on whether or not the language used by Elissa Slotkin should be used in the article when she said: 
<blockquote>"For the sake of Michigan‚Äôs economy and our working families, I hope this strike is short-lived. As someone who used to negotiate international agreements, I know that no one should let the perfect be the enemy of the good. I hope the UAW and the Big Three continue to negotiate in good faith to reach a fair agreement as quickly as possible."</blockquote>
There has been a lot of contention over the meaning of this quote, with many saying it is anti-union and some saying it is pro-union or mundane. There has also been a debate over many of the sources that have been used quoting her as being anti-union, many of which are deemed reputable by Wikipedia (although there are debates over biases). Considering this, should this quote be characterized or partially included on the article? [[User:OrcaLord|OrcaLord]] ([[User talk:OrcaLord|talk]]) 02:25, 30 March 2024 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia:Username policy/RFC 2024#rfc_46DB6FE|Wikipedia:Username policy/RFC 2024]] expired 2024-05-01 17:01 ===
* Id: 46DB6FE
* User: CaptainEek
* Date: 2024-05-01 05:35:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|1221633863|POLICY 1221633863}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|1221725540|POLICY 1221725540}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
==Non-ASCII usernames'''

{{atop|I am taking the unusual but unfortunately necessary step of closing this RfC early for a failure to follow [[WP:RFCBEFORE]]. This proposal demonstrates a failure to consider how unified login works, among other issues. The user in question appears to have done zero consultation before creating and widely advertising this RfC. I understand the desire to create RfC's on issues we all care about, but these days, most RfC's need at least some discussion ahead of time to work out obvious issues. If there is truly a genuine problem, I suggest that OP first workshop the idea at either [[WT:UN]] or an area like [[WP:VPI]]. [[User:CaptainEek|<b style="color:#6a1f7f">CaptainEek</b>]] <sup>[[User talk:CaptainEek|<i style="font-size:82%; color:#a479e5">Edits Ho Cap'n!</i>]]</sup>[[Special:Contributions/CaptainEek|‚öì]] 05:35, 1 May 2024 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia talk:Political endorsements#rfc_5B4DBB5|Wikipedia talk:Political endorsements]] expired 2024-05-04 09:01 ===
* Id: 5B4DBB5
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1217182772|POL 1217182772}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1222164906|POL 1222164906}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
In the RfC that this guideline is based on, it seems to be taken for granted that endorsements by notable individuals that are not covered by reliable and independent sources fail the inclusion criteria, but endorsements by notable organizations inherently merit inclusion. Somebody raised this important point in

=== [[Wikipedia_talk:Political_endorsements#RfC_on_Part_2_2|a prior RfC]] expired 2024-05-04 09:01 ===
* Id: 
* User: 97.155.100.43
* Date: 2024-04-04 08:41:00
* RFC Text:
but received no meaningful answer. Here's a more airtight example:
*[[Geert Wilders]] tweets his endorsement of [[Christine Chandler]] for her reelection. No journalists cover it, so we do not mention it.
*The [[Party for Freedom]], of whom Wilders is [[Party_for_Freedom#Organisation_and_support|the sole member]], endorses Chandler in a press release on their website. It is inherently reliable and therefore included because the PVV is a group.
So why the double standard? [[Special:Contributions/97.155.100.43|97.155.100.43]] ([[User talk:97.155.100.43|talk]]) 08:41, 4 April 2024 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Edinburgh#rfc_8B0C074|Talk:Edinburgh]] expired 2024-05-04 13:01 ===
* Id: 8B0C074
* User: Liverpolitan1980
* Date: 2024-05-04 10:40:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|1222175521|HIST 1222175521}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|1222187014|HIST 1222187014}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
I noticed that a contributor has changed the lead section of the [[Liverpool]] article just recently. The Liverpool lead section now only includes Liverpool's local authority population and the population of the official city region. Having looked at the [[Birmingham]] [[Leeds]] and [[Edinburgh]] articles, I notice that their lead sections make reference to the wider metropolitan area. 

To quote the Birmingham article lead section: "The wider metropolitan area has a population of 4.3 million, making it the largest outside of London." The citation is worldpopulationreview.com

To quote the Leeds article: "The city is part of the fourth-largest built-up area by population in the United Kingdom, West Yorkshire Built-up Area, with a 2011 census population of 1.7 million" The citation is ONS Census 2011. The WY Built-up Area is out of date and is not calculated any more. But I am wondering if this needs to be in the lead section as an editor has removed mention of Liverpool metropolitan area from its lead section. 

To quote the [[Edinburgh]] lead section, "The wider metropolitan area has a population of 912,490." The citation is OECD.

I am sure there are many many examples on wiki where city articles make reference to a wider 'urban region' or metropolitan area.

Should we be aiming for consistency in these articles? I have also started an RfC on the Leeds, Birmingham and Liverpool articles. [[User:Liverpolitan1980|Liverpolitan1980]] ([[User talk:Liverpolitan1980|talk]]) 10:40, 4 May 2024 (UTC)}}

* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
I noticed that a contributor has changed the lead section of the [[Liverpool]] article just recently. The Liverpool lead section now only includes Liverpool's local authority population and the population of the official city region. Having looked at the [[Birmingham]] [[Leeds]] and [[Edinburgh]] articles, I notice that their lead sections make reference to the wider metropolitan area. 

To quote the Birmingham article lead section: "The wider metropolitan area has a population of 4.3 million, making it the largest outside of London." The citation is worldpopulationreview.com

To quote the Leeds article: "The city is part of the fourth-largest built-up area by population in the United Kingdom, West Yorkshire Built-up Area, with a 2011 census population of 1.7 million" The citation is ONS Census 2011. The WY Built-up Area is out of date and is not calculated any more. But I am wondering if this needs to be in the lead section as an editor has removed mention of Liverpool metropolitan area from its lead section. 

To quote the [[Edinburgh]] lead section, "The wider metropolitan area has a population of 912,490." The citation is OECD.

I am sure there are many many examples on wiki where city articles make reference to a wider 'urban region' or metropolitan area.

Should we be aiming for consistency in these articles? I have also started an RfC on the Liverpool, Birmingham and Edinburgh articles. [[User:Liverpolitan1980|Liverpolitan1980]] ([[User talk:Liverpolitan1980|talk]]) 10:40, 4 May 2024 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:International Churches of Christ#rfc_57163EC|Talk:International Churches of Christ]] expired 2024-05-04 15:01 ===
* Id: 57163EC
* User: Meta Voyager
* Date: 2024-04-15 17:26:00
* RFC Text:

<nowiki>Wikipedia articles about religious organizations often contain a ‚Äúbeliefs‚Äù section that describes the beliefs and practices of the organization and its members. Is About Self sourcing on the organization‚Äôs beliefs or practices acceptable as Reliable Sourcing when the information is derived directly from the religious organization or published by an employee or member of the organization irrespective of whether secondary sourcing is available? This RfC assumes that all other Wikipedia editing policies are observed. ~~~~ </nowiki> [[User:Meta Voyager|Meta Voyager]] ([[User talk:Meta Voyager|talk]]) 17:26, 15 April 2024 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Havana syndrome#rfc_9FB246D|Talk:Havana syndrome]] expired 2024-05-05 22:01 ===
* Id: 9FB246D
* User: FailedMusician
* Date: 2024-04-25 02:29:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|1220655849|HIST 1220655849}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|1220655852|SCI 1220655852}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1220655854|POL 1220655854}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|1220655857|SOC 1220655857}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|1225540999|HIST 1225540999}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|1225541002|SCI 1225541002}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1225541003|POL 1225541003}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|1225541004|SOC 1225541004}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
There is ongoing discussion about how to best present the content of the ''Insider investigative report'' on a Russian connection to Havana Syndrome. Two versions have been proposed, and we seek wider community input on which should be included in the article. The discussion has raised concerns about the due weight of content relating to allegations of secret weapons use by Russian military intelligence's GRU Unit 29155.

'''Version 2.1:'''
{{talkquote|On March 31, 2024, ''[[The Insider (website)|The Insider]]'', in collaboration with ''[[60 Minutes]]'' and ''[[Der Spiegel]]'', published an investigative report reigniting speculation that hostile Russian action was responsible for the syndrome.<ref name="kremlin-dismisses">https://www.reuters.com/world/europe/kremlin-dismisses-report-russia-behind-havana-syndrome-2024-04-01/</ref><ref name=":4">{{Cite web |title=Havana syndrome: Report links mystery illness to Russian intelligence unit |url=https://www.bbc.com/news/world-us-canada-68706317 |access-date=2024-04-02 |website=www.bbc.com}}</ref> The Kremlin Press Secretary dismissed the report as "nothing more than baseless, unfounded accusations by the media." In response to the report, the White House Press Secretary said that a "foreign adversary is very unlikely." Following the report, several U.S. Senators, including [[Susan Collins]], [[Jeanne Shaheen]], and [[Mark Warner]], sent a letter to the President calling for further investigation into the cause of the anomalous health incidents.}}

'''Version 3.1:'''
{{tqb|On March 31 2024, ''[[The Insider (website)|The Insider]]'', in collaboration with ''[[60 Minutes]]'' and ''[[Der Spiegel]],'' published an investigative report claiming that the syndrome was caused by actions of [[GRU (Russian Federation)|Russian military intelligence]].<ref name="kremlin-dismisses"/><ref name=":4"/><ref name="guardian-report"/> The report states that members of the [[GRU Unit 29155]], known for undertaking foreign operations<ref name=":4"/>, received awards and promotions for work related to the development and deployment of "[[Directed-energy weapon|non-lethal acoustic weapons]]", and that telephone and travel data pinpointing the locations of these agents correlated with the timings and locations of Havana Syndrome incidents worldwide.<ref name="Dobrokhotov"/><ref name=":3"/><ref name="SpiegelMarch2024"/><br /><br />The [[Kremlin Press Secretary]] dismissed the report as "nothing more than baseless, unfounded accusations by the media."<ref name="kremlin-dismisses"/> In response to the report, the [[White House Press Secretary]] said that a "foreign adversary is very unlikely."<ref name="us-not-moved"/><br /><br />Following the report, in a letter addressed to the [[President of the United States|President]] several U.S. Senators called for further investigations into the causes of the anomalous health incidents.<ref name="letter-request-senators">{{Cite web |last=Chasan |first=Aliza |date=2024-04-17 |title=Senators call for renewed Havana Syndrome assessment after 60 Minutes report - CBS News |url=https://www.cbsnews.com/news/senators-urge-renewed-havana-syndrome-assessment-60-minutes/ |access-date=2024-04-24 |website=www.cbsnews.com |language=en-US}}</ref>}}

Please provide your opinions and rationale for supporting either version 2.1 or 3.1 and please ensure your responses are based on Wikipedia's content policies and guidelines. ([[User:FailedMusician|FailedMusician]] ([[User talk:FailedMusician|talk]]) 02:29, 25 April 2024 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Havana syndrome#rfc_E57E8CC|Talk:Havana syndrome]] expired 2024-05-05 22:01 ===
* Id: E57E8CC
* User: Noleander
* Date: 2024-04-05 21:52:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|1217448767|SCI 1217448767}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1217448771|POL 1217448771}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|1222427105|SCI 1222427105}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1222427111|POL 1222427111}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
 
Three related questions:

a) Can this article include non-medical information about Havana Syndrome (provided the information is properly sourced)? Examples of non-medical information include politics, economics, relationship to cold war, espionage, directed energy weapons,  statements by foreign governments, conflict-of-interest allegations, and historical chronology of hypotheses & research.  Example of non-medical information:  Financial compensation from ''Havana Act'' <ref name=BarnesOct8>{{cite news |first1=Julian E. |last1=Barnes |first2=David E. |last2=Sanger |first3=Katie |last3=Rogers |url=https://www.nytimes.com/2021/10/08/us/politics/havana-syndrome-biden-law.html |title=Biden Signs Legislation to Compensate Victims of Mysterious 'Havana Syndrome' |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20211018154415/https://www.nytimes.com/2021/10/08/us/politics/havana-syndrome-biden-law.html |archive-date=October 18, 2021 |work=The New York Times |date=October 8, 2021}}</ref> and <ref name="Collins Bill">{{Cite web|date=May 25, 2021|title=S.1828 - HAVANA Act of 2021|url=https://www.congress.gov/bill/117th-congress/senate-bill/1828/text?r=3&s=1|publisher=United States Congress|access-date=June 25, 2021|archive-date=June 25, 2021|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210625134327/https://www.congress.gov/bill/117th-congress/senate-bill/1828/text?r=3&s=1|url-status=live}}</ref>.

b) Can this article include USA government reports, studies and statements from the executive branch, US Congress, CIA, Department of Defense, State department, National Institutes of Health, etc. (provided they are reported on by major media)? Specifically, is it okay if some sources are ''not'' from medical or scientific journals?   Examples of government reports:  <ref name="JASON2021">{{cite web |title=An Analysis of Data and Hypotheses Related to the Embassy Incidents |url=https://www.state.gov/wp-content/uploads/2022/02/JASON-Study-Revised_10-February-2022-Redacted_V1.1.pdf |website=state.gov |publisher=United States Department of State |access-date=October 19, 2022 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20221014084219/https://www.state.gov/wp-content/uploads/2022/02/JASON-Study-Revised_10-February-2022-Redacted_V1.1.pdf |archive-date=October 14, 2022 |language=en-US |date=February 10, 2022 |url-status=live}}</ref> and  <ref>"Most ‚ÄòHavana Syndrome‚Äô Cases Unlikely Caused by Foreign Power, C.I.A. Says" Julian Barnes  20 Jan 2022, ''NY Times'' https://www.nytimes.com/2022/01/20/us/politics/havana-syndrome-cia-report.html"</ref>.

c) For medical information in this article:  does [[WP:MEDRS]] prohibit the use of primary medical sources in this article?  Opposing view: Havana Syndrome is relatively new and evolving so it is okay to use primary medical sources in some situations (for example,  when the primary source is widely reported in major media; or when the primary source is reporting a significant new result; or when there are no secondary sources yet available that have reviewed and summarized the primary source).    Examples of recent widely-reported primary sources that have not been assessed by a secondary source:    <ref name="PierPal">Pierpaoli C., Nayak A., Hafiz R., et al. [https://jamanetwork.com/journals/jama/fullarticle/2816532 Neuroimaging Findings in US Government Personnel and Their Family Members Involved in Anomalous Health Incidents]. JAMA. Published online March 18, 2024. {{doi|10.1001/jama.2024.2424}}.</ref>     and <ref name="jama1">{{Cite journal |last1=Chan |first1=Leighton |last2=Hallett |first2=Mark |last3=Zalewski |first3=Chris K. |last4=Brewer |first4=Carmen C. |last5=Zampieri |first5=Cris |last6=Hoa |first6=Michael |last7=Lippa |first7=Sara M. |last8=Fitzgibbon |first8=Edmond |last9=French |first9=Louis M. |last10=Moses |first10=Anita D. |last11=van der Merwe |first11=Andr√© J. |last12=Pierpaoli |first12=Carlo |last13=Turtzo |first13=L. Christine |last14=Yonter |first14=Simge |last15=Shahim |first15=Pashtun |date=2024-03-18 |title=Clinical, Biomarker, and Research Tests Among US Government Personnel and Their Family Members Involved in Anomalous Health Incidents |url=https://jamanetwork.com/journals/jama/fullarticle/2816533 |journal=JAMA |language=en |doi=10.1001/jama.2024.2413 |pmid=38497797 |issn=0098-7484}}</ref> 

[[User:Noleander|Noleander]] ([[User talk:Noleander|talk]]) 21:52, 5 April 2024 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Israel‚ÄìHamas war#rfc_4433340|Talk:Israel‚ÄìHamas war]] expired 2024-05-06 12:01 ===
* Id: 4433340
* Date: 2024-05-06 05:30:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|1222482930|HIST 1222482930}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|1222622342|HIST 1222622342}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
This RfC asks several questions about how the lede should refer to casualties in Gaza:
#Should the figures be attributed?
#:If "yes", before the casualty figures the text could read {{tq|according to the [[Gaza Health Ministry]]}}
#Should the number of militants that Israel has stated they have killed be included?
#:If "yes", the third sentence could read {{tq|Israeli forces say they have killed an estimated 13,000 Palestinian militants during the conflict.}}
#Should we describe the number of women and children killed as:
#:'''3A''': {{tq|...with a majority consisting of over 14,000 children and 9,000 women}}
#:'''3B''': {{tq|...including over 14,000 children and 9,000 women}}
#:'''3C''': {{tq|...with a majority consisting of women and children}}
#Should we describe those killed who are under the age of 18 as:
#:'''4A''': {{tq|children}}
#:'''4B''': {{tq|minors}}

05:30, 6 May 2024 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Liverpool#rfc_86D1C73|Talk:Liverpool]] expired 2024-05-06 16:01 ===
* Id: 86D1C73
* User: Liverpolitan1980
* Date: 2024-05-04 10:40:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|1222175521|HIST 1222175521}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|1222549435|HIST 1222549435}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
I noticed that a contributor has changed the lead section of the [[Liverpool]] article just recently. The Liverpool lead section now only includes Liverpool's local authority population and the population of the official city region. Having looked at the [[Birmingham]] [[Leeds]] and [[Edinburgh]] articles, I notice that their lead sections make reference to the wider metropolitan area. 

To quote the Birmingham article lead section: "The wider metropolitan area has a population of 4.3 million, making it the largest outside of London." The citation is worldpopulationreview.com

To quote the Leeds article: "The city is part of the fourth-largest built-up area by population in the United Kingdom, West Yorkshire Built-up Area, with a 2011 census population of 1.7 million" The citation is ONS Census 2011. The WY Built-up Area is out of date and is not calculated any more. But I am wondering if this needs to be in the lead section as an editor has removed mention of Liverpool metropolitan area from its lead section. 

To quote the [[Edinburgh]] lead section, "The wider metropolitan area has a population of 912,490." The citation is OECD.

I am sure there are many many examples on wiki where city articles make reference to a wider 'urban region' or metropolitan area.

Should we be aiming for consistency in these articles? I have also started an RfC on the Leeds, Birmingham and Edinburgh articles. [[User:Liverpolitan1980|Liverpolitan1980]] ([[User talk:Liverpolitan1980|talk]]) 10:40, 4 May 2024 (UTC)}}

* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
 Should there be a new R5 criteria for incorrectly formatted redirects to DAB pages? {{tq|Redirects to disambiguation pages with malformities qualifiers such as [[Foo (desambiguation)]], [[Foo (DISAMBIGUATION)]] and [[Foo (Disambiguation)]], this excludes redirect using the correct [[WP:INTDAB]] title namely [[Foo (disambiguation)]] or any title that has useful history. Redirects with incorrect qualifiers that don't target disambiguation pages can be deleted under G14.}} '''[[User:Crouch, Swale|<span style="color:Green">Crouch, Swale</span>]]''' ([[User talk:Crouch, Swale|<span style="color:Blue">talk</span>]])  18:50, 6 April 2024 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Port Erin Women's Detention Camp#rfc_210B0A4|Talk:Port Erin Women's Detention Camp]] expired 2024-05-06 21:01 ===
* Id: 210B0A4
* User: Orange sticker
* Date: 2024-05-06 14:39:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|1222541364|HIST 1222541364}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|1222597840|HIST 1222597840}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
In the [https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-europe-isle-of-man-32810383 first reference] to this article, the name of the camp is the '''Rushen Internment Camp'''. I have also found [https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-europe-isle-of-man-66155525 other] [https://holocaustcentrenorth.org.uk/blog/enemy-aliens-the-british-interment-camps-on-the-isle-of-man/ references] to the "Europe's only all-female internment camp" naming it as Rushen, based in Port Erin. It seems this article needs to be renamed (and the part about Rushen camp being for couples removed if it can't be verified) but history is not my forte, so wondering if anyone can shed any light how this article came to have the Port Erin name in the first place? [[User:Orange sticker|Orange sticker]] ([[User talk:Orange sticker|talk]]) 14:39, 6 May 2024 (UTC)}}
