[[User:MolecularPilot|<span style="color: #0369a1; font-family:monospace">MolecularPilot</span>]] <sup>[[User talk:MolecularPilot|üß™Ô∏è]][[Special:Contributions/MolecularPilot|‚úàÔ∏è]]</sup> 05:12, 16 December 2024 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Republican Party (United States)#rfc_492E69E|Talk:Republican Party (United States)]] expired 2024-12-17 16:01 ===
* Id: 492E69E
* User: JohnAdams1800
* Date: 2024-12-16 17:08:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1263441706|POL 1263441706}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1263449904|POL 1263449904}}
* RFC Text:

In the wake of Donald Trump winning the 2024 presidential election, and the sheer number of RS that say that right-wing populism is the dominant faction of the Republican Party, as well as plenty of sources documenting how the Reagan-era conservative faction of the party has lost nearly all of its influence, can we move up right-wing populism to be alongside conservatism as the party's main ideology? @[[User:Toa Nidhiki05|Toa Nidhiki05]]
My personal views: I have written a lot of the section on right-wing populists in the factions section. There is too much to list here. But the key is the party's demographic base shift:
* '''Demographically,''' the Republican Party has lost its prior majority support from White voters with college degrees it had since Eisenhower and Goldwater (1950s & 1960s) to 2012. The party also has roughly 2:1 support from White voters with college degrees. Non-whites are harder to get a good read on, but in 2024 Trump won close to a majority of Hispanic voters, what appears to be a majority of Native American voters, and a significant percentage of Asian American voters. Trump won at most about 15% of African American voters.
Also I created two bar plots of the states Trump and Harris won by educational attainment. Except for New Mexico, every single state Harris won had above-average educational attainment. Trump did win four states (Utah, Pennsylvania, Kansas, and North Carolina) with above-average educational attainment, but his core strength was with below-average educational attainment states. 

It appears that the key dividing line between the two parties is education. The income divide appears to have inverted, with Harris winning a majority of voters who made over $200,000 a year. Trump won 56% of voters without a college degree, and 42% of voters with a college degree. Harris won 56% of voters with a college degree, and 42% of voters without a college degree. These are mirror images of each other. The reason Trump won is 43% of voters have college degrees, and 57% don't.

Note: I am a statistician, and this data comes from the exit polls and Census data. I don't make the data, just analyze it.
[[User:JohnAdams1800|JohnAdams1800]] ([[User talk:JohnAdams1800|talk]]) 17:08, 16 December 2024 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Isles of Scilly#rfc_06B588A|Talk:Isles of Scilly]] expired 2024-12-19 00:01 ===
* Id: 06B588A
* User: 86.184.52.46
* Date: 2024-11-18 23:46:00

{{rfcquote|text=
Trewartha's Book in which he defines his climate classification system clearly states marine climates in this category must be frostless. (ISBN 9780700651481 Chapter: Subtropical climates, pages 330-362). Met Office data (https://www.metoffice.gov.uk/research/climate/maps-and-data/uk-climate-averages/gbgebz4kn) shows the Isles of Scilly are not frostless. So how can the Isles of Scilly be considered "subtropical". Can anyone provide academic comment and/or third-party reliable sources that specifically claim the Isles of Scilly are subtropical? === [[Talk:Russo-Ukrainian War#rfc_9234A66|Talk:Russo-Ukrainian War]] expired 2024-12-21 15:01 ===
* Id: 9234A66
* User: Slatersteven
* Date: 2024-11-21 14:15:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:

=== [[Wikipedia talk:WikiProject Weather#rfc_8CB15D9|Wikipedia talk:WikiProject Weather]] expired 2024-12-21 23:01 ===
* Id: 8CB15D9
* User: EF5
* Date: 2024-12-16 18:56:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|1263449903|SCI 1263449903}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|1264419197|SCI 1264419197}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Should we have notability standards for individual tornado articles? We already have informal inclusion criteria for "Tornadoes of YYYY" articles. Below is a preliminary proposal for such criteria, with the hope that it can evolve into a formal guideline that can possibly be referenced in future AfD discussions.

[[File:Symbol recycling vote.svg|20px|alt=recycle]] '''Previous discussions:''' [[Wikipedia talk:WikiProject Weather/Archive 5#New tornado articles and the news|New tornado articles and the news]], [[Wikipedia talk:WikiProject Weather/Archive 4#Proposal - Criteria for inclusion on Tornadoes of XXXX articles|Proposal - Criteria for inclusion on Tornadoes of XXXX articles]]

This has been nagging at me for a while now, and since another editor has talked to me about this issue, I think we bring this up. Since we have a sort of "inclusion criteria" for "Tornadoes of YYYY" articles, I suggest we come up with notability criteria for individual tornadoes as well. I'll be copy-and-pasting this from [[User:EF5/My tornado criteria]]:

{| class="wikitable"
|+EF5's Tornado AfD Table
!Criteria no.
!Sub-criteria
!Description
!Pass?
!Fail?
!Comments
|-
| rowspan="3" |1 (Coverage)
!1a
|Any coverage?
!
!
|Quick-delete if criterion is not met
|-
!1b
|Any '''significant''' coverge? (e.g. [[CNN]] or the [[NYT]])
!
!
|
|-
!1c
|Any lasting coverage past 6 months after the tornado?
!
!
|Usually a quick-keep
|-
! rowspan="4" |2 (Strength)
!2a
!Was the tornado EF0-EF2?
! colspan="2" |
!Usually a sign of non-notability, there are exceptions to this though
|-
!2b
!Was the tornado EF3?
! colspan="2" |
!May be a sign of notability
|-
!2c
!Was the tornado EF4?
! colspan="2" |
!Usually a sign of notability
|-
!2d
!Was the tornado EF5?
! colspan="2" |
!If a post-2013 EF5, then an instant keep. Usually a quick-keep
|-
| rowspan="3" |3 (Damage)
!3a
|Did the tornado kill at least one person?
!
!
|Usually a sign of notability
|-
!3b
|Did the tornado injure at least one person?
!
!
|
|-
!3c
|Did the tornado cause monetary damage totaling over $200,000 USD?
!
!
|
|-
| rowspan="2" |4 (Aftermath)
!4a
|Did the tornado significantly damage a town?
!
!
|If not, then usually a sign of non-notability
|-
!4b
|Any notable deaths?
!
!
|Usually not the case, can be skipped
|-
| rowspan="4" |5 (Content)
!5a
|Is the article not a [[Wikipedia:CFORK|CFORK]] of an existing section?
!
!
|Merge if criterion is not met
|-
!5b
|Can the content not be easily merged into a section?
!
!
|Merge if criterion is not met
|-
!5c
|Is the article longer than the page on its respective outbreak? 
!
!
|Usually a quick-keep
|-
!5d
|Is the article a [[Wikipedia:GA|GA]], [[Wikipedia:FA|FA]] or has recently been featured on [[Wikipedia:DYK|DYK]]?
!
!
|Usually a quick-keep
|-
|6 (Overall)
!6a
|Are at least five of these criterion met, with exceptions made if needed?
!
!
|If at least '''1b''', '''3b''', '''3c''', '''5c''' and '''1c''' are met, then a keep is  warranted. If not, then a delete/other option is warranted. Exceptions can be made.
|-
! colspan="2" |'''<big>Final verdict:</big>'''
! colspan="4" |
|}

This is my very primitive way of determining the notability of several tornado articles I've written, and am hoping that it could be integrated into a refined set-in-stone WPW policy that could be used in actual AfDs. I'd assume that the table will be gotten rid of and turned into a list. This has been discussed in the past, but never really came to anything. Maybe it could be... [[WP:NTORNADO]] (with it's own project page)? Starting an RfC, since obviously community input is needed. Also pinging {{ping|Departure‚Äì}}, who suggested this. :) [[User:EF5|<span style="color:#A188FC;">'''E'''</span>]]<sub>[[User talk:EF5|<span style="color:#A188FC;">'''F'''</span>]]</sub><sup>[[User:EF5/Creations|<span style="color:#A188FC;">'''5'''</span>]]</sup> 18:56, 16 December 2024 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Decline in insect populations#rfc_F39F663|Talk:Decline in insect populations]] expired 2024-12-22 16:01 ===
* Id: F39F663
* User: Jtbobwaysf
* Date: 2024-11-22 15:28:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Economy,_trade,_and_companies|prev|1258960151|ECON 1258960151}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|1258960155|SCI 1258960155}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1258960161|POL 1258960161}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Economy,_trade,_and_companies|prev|1264604592|ECON 1264604592}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|1264604597|SCI 1264604597}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1264604600|POL 1264604600}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Include or Exclude [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Decline_in_insect_populations&diff=1258422122&oldid=1257899879 (diff)] this text:
 In October 2024, researchers from the [[European Molecular Biology Laboratory]] tested the influence of insecticides, herbicides, fungicides and plant growth inhibitors in the laboratory against to larvae of the [[Drosophila melanogaster|fruit fly]], caterpillars of painted lady butterflies ([[Vanessa cardui]]) and in larvae of [[Mosquito|mosquitoes]] ([[Anopheles stephensi]]). Results suggested that agrochemical exposure, even at sublethal levels, affects insect populations.<ref>{{Cite journal |last=Gandara |first=Lautaro |last2=Jacoby |first2=Richard |last3=Laurent |first3=Fran√ßois |last4=Spatuzzi |first4=Matteo |last5=Vlachopoulos |first5=Nikolaos |last6=Borst |first6=Noa O. |last7=Ekmen |first7=G√ºlina |last8=Potel |first8=Clement M. |last9=Garrido-Rodriguez |first9=Martin |last10=B√∂hmert |first10=Antonia L. |last11=Misunou |first11=Natalia |last12=Bartmanski |first12=Bartosz J. |last13=Li |first13=Xueying C. |last14=Kutra |first14=Dominik |last15=H√©rich√© |first15=Jean-Karim |date=2024-10-25 |title=Pervasive sublethal effects of agrochemicals on insects at environmentally relevant concentrations |url=https://www.science.org/doi/10.1126/science.ado0251 |journal=Science |language=en |volume=386 |issue=6720 |pages=446‚Äì453 |doi=10.1126/science.ado0251 |issn=0036-8075}}</ref>

Thanks for your comments! [[User:Jtbobwaysf|Jtbobwaysf]] ([[User talk:Jtbobwaysf|talk]]) 15:28, 22 November 2024 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:7 October Hamas-led attack on Israel#rfc_B7FAE53|Talk:7 October Hamas-led attack on Israel]] expired 2024-12-22 21:01 ===
* Id: B7FAE53
* User: Smallangryplanet
* Date: 2024-12-22 10:05:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|1264551899|HIST 1264551899}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|1264657777|HIST 1264657777}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
There has been some [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Talk:7_October_Hamas-led_attack_on_Israel#Events_outside_of_the_scope_of_the_article debate] between @[[User:Alaexis|Alaexis]] and myself over whether or not it is acceptable to include information in this article about events that did not happen on 7-8 October 2023. The events and text in question generally revolve around references to a summer 2024 [https://www.ohchr.org/sites/default/files/documents/hrbodies/hrcouncil/sessions-regular/session56/a-hrc-56-26-auv.docx UN report] (note that this is a link to a .docx file which your browser may immediately download) that {{tq|deals with violations and possible crimes committed between 7 October and 31 December 2023}}. Some non-exhaustive examples of information that is being considered for removal/inclusion:

{{tq|Some of the released hostages also shared testimonies of sexual violence during their time in Gaza.[293] Israel accused international women's rights and human rights groups of downplaying the assaults.[308]}}

{{tq|Patten also reported receiving "clear and convincing information" that some of the hostages held by Hamas had suffered rape and sexualized torture and that there were "reasonable grounds" to believe such abuses were "ongoing".[316]}}

Possible options:

# Leave the article as is, containing references to the report and the information that includes references to non-7-8-October-2023-events.
# Remove this information entirely and strike any references to anything that happened before or after those two days.
# Remove information about anything that happened after 7-8 October 2023.
# Retain the content, but find reliable sources that specifically only deal with the events of 7-8 October 2023.

Other options...?

[[User:Smallangryplanet|Smallangryplanet]] ([[User talk:Smallangryplanet|talk]]) 10:05, 22 December 2024 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Transnational repression#rfc_B6C645C|Talk:Transnational repression]] expired 2024-12-25 17:01 ===
* Id: B6C645C
* User: MINQI
* Date: 2024-11-25 16:52:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1259718014|POL 1259718014}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1265194731|POL 1265194731}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
There are two news/articles about Assange's speech and mentioned transnational repression.

1.[https://jacobin.com/2024/10/julian-assange-wikileaks-pace "This came at a cost. Assange recounted the legal attacks ('lawfare'), surveillance, and various illegal CIA plots against him, describing it as a form of transnational repression. "]‚Äî‚Äî Chip Gibbons, [[Jacobin (magazine)|Jacobin]]

2.[https://www.rfi.fr/en/international/20241002-european-rights-body-finds-prosecution-of-wikileaks-assange-politically-motivated <nowiki>"The PACE resolution said it was 'alarmed' by reports that the CIA was covertly surveying Assange in the Ecuadorian Embassy in London and 'allegedly developing plans to poison or even assassinate him on United Kingdom soil'.[PACE] reiterates its condemnation of all forms and practices of transnational repression"</nowiki>]‚Äî‚Äî In the chapter "Transnational repression" [[Radio France Internationale]]

Should these information to be added here? Someone insists to delete these with the reason [[WP:DUE]]. But I think these should be remained for 
:1. Assange is name prominent adherent; "Jacobin" and "RFI" are mainstream media; So it is qualified for WP:DUE.
:2. The removing of these information is against [[Wikipedia:YESPOV|"does not mean the exclusion of certain points of view; rather, it means including all verifiable points of view which have sufficient due weight."]], because none point of these information will be remained.

I want to write these as:
:"In Assange's 2024 October speech to the Parliamentary Assembly of the Council of Europe, he recounted the legal attacks (‚Äúlawfare‚Äù), surveillance, and various illegal CIA plots against him and described it as a form of transnational repression.<ref>{{cite web |last1=Gibbons |first1=Chip |title=A Newly Free Julian Assange Speaks |url=https://jacobin.com/2024/10/julian-assange-wikileaks-pace |website=Jacobin |publisher=Jacobin |access-date=14 November 2024}}</ref> The [[Parliamentary Assembly of the Council of Europe|PACE]] resolution saided that, it was "alarmed" by reports that the CIA was covertly surveying Assange in the Ecuadorian Embassy in London and reiterated its condemnation of all forms and practices of transnational repression.<ref>{{cite news |title=European rights body finds prosecution of WikiLeaks' Assange 'politically motivated'-'Transnational repression' |url=https://www.rfi.fr/en/international/20241002-european-rights-body-finds-prosecution-of-wikileaks-assange-politically-motivated |access-date=14 November 2024 |agency=RFI |issue=RFI |date=2 October 2024 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20241007112834/https://www.rfi.fr/en/international/20241002-european-rights-body-finds-prosecution-of-wikileaks-assange-politically-motivated |archive-date=7 October 2024 |language=EN}}</ref>"  [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Transnational_repression&diff=prev&oldid=1259523065 diff]
--[[User:MINQI|MINQI]] ([[User talk:MINQI|talk]]) 16:52, 25 November 2024 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia talk:Biographies of living persons#rfc_337E1E7|Wikipedia talk:Biographies of living persons]] expired 2024-12-26 18:01 ===
* Id: 337E1E7
* User: Ad Orientem
* Date: 2024-11-26 17:55:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|1259718010|BIO 1259718010}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1259718014|POL 1259718014}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|1259718020|POLICY 1259718020}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|1265389026|BIO 1265389026}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1265389029|POL 1265389029}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|1265389033|POLICY 1265389033}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
I propose the following text be added to WP:SUSPECT:
:''Given the legal presumption of innocence, criminal proceedings including those against prominent public persons, should not be mentioned on the [[Main_Page|main page]] of the encyclopdia until the cases are resolved either by conviction or acquittal. Any appellate proceedings shall have no bearing on whether or not to post the initial findings of a duly constituted court of law."
I have decided to post this as an RfC as this would involve a non-trivial amendment to [[WP:POLICY]] and the issue has become a contentious point of debate involving several nominations at [[WP:ITNC]]. -[[User:Ad Orientem|Ad Orientem]] ([[User talk:Ad Orientem|talk]]) 17:55, 26 November 2024 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Jesus#rfc_387A9B2|Talk:Jesus]] expired 2024-12-27 19:01 ===
* Id: 387A9B2
* User: HumansRightsIsCool
* Date: 2024-12-26 15:10:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|1265371166|HIST 1265371166}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|1265603422|HIST 1265603422}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
RfC: Should the following paragraph be added to [[WP:NMOTORSPORT]]?

{{tqb|10. <s>Meet the following criteria for the the respective single seater series:</s> <u>A driver who has met at least one of the following criteria for single seater racing:</u>
* Completion of one full season ''or'' a race winner in a [[Formula Regional]] series.
* Completion of one full season ''or'' a race winner in [[W Series (championship)|W Series]]/[[F1 Academy]].
* Podium finish in the [[Macau Grand Prix]] (single seater).
* Champion or runner up in a [[Formula 4]] series.}}

=== [[Talk:2005 Birmingham tornado#rfc_25C9901|Talk:2005 Birmingham tornado]] expired 2024-12-31 17:01 ===
* Id: 25C9901
* User: WeatherWriter
* Date: 2024-12-20 03:20:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|1264050424|HIST 1264050424}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|1264050427|SCI 1264050427}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|1266443847|HIST 1266443847}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|1266443850|SCI 1266443850}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Should the article‚Äôs infobox reflect EF2/T4 or F3/T5-6? This question stems from the fact the infobox inputs can only accept a single set of values (i.e. EF2/T4 or F3/T5-6, not both). The EF2/T4 rating comes from a peer reviewed paper by [[Timothy P. Marshall]] and Stuart Robinson with the Haag Engineering Co. [https://www.researchgate.net/publication/327022710_Birmingham_UK_Tornado_28_July_2005 which was published] in the [[American Meteorological Society]] in August 2006. The F3/T5-6 rating comes from the [[TORRO|Tornado and Storm Research Organisation]] (TORRO), the creators of the [[TORRO scale]], T-scale, [https://www.torro.org.uk/pdf/Birmingham_Tornado_10_Year_Anniversary.pdf published in this 2015 paper].

Since the infobox can only contain one set of the ratings, this discussion more or less needs to determine which source (Haag Engineering Co. or TORRO) should be the infobox source. 
*'''Option 1''' ‚Äî EF2/T4 using the Haag Engineering Co. paper.
*'''Option 2''' ‚Äî F3/T5-6 using the [[TORRO]] paper.

'''The [[User:WeatherWriter|Weather Event Writer]]''' ([[User talk:WeatherWriter|Talk Page)]] 03:20, 20 December 2024 (UTC)}}
